campaign.story:
HOW WOULD IT FEEL TO ACCOMPLISH EVERY SINGLE GOAL YOU SET OUT FOR YOURSELF THIS YEAR?
How successful could you be if you stopped being slowed down by day-to-day distractions, and started making real, tangible progress on your most important work and goals? 
If you’re tired of always feeling like you’re farther behind than you want to be, and you’re ready to start accomplishing the things you want truly to do that will move your career and your life forward, then you need the Spark Planner. 
HOW BIG DO YOU DREAM? THE SPARK PLANNER'S PROVEN SYSTEM WILL GET YOU THERE
The Spark Planner is a proven planning system designed to help you accomplish everything you want in 2016 (and beyond!). Designed and delivered by the same team that brought you the incredibly popular Spark Notebook, the Spark Planner takes the very best goal-setting, planning, and personal organization tools from that notebook and bundles them into a full year of laser-focused amazing success and productivity.
You don't need to be perfect or have superpowers to be successful. You just need the right tools. Anyone can be amazing. You can be amazing.
The Spark Planner is sleek, beautiful, and designed to make you more successful. We have taken the science of setting and achieving your goals and wrapped it into one beautifully designed planner - and you won't want to start your year without it.
With the Spark Planner, success is always at your fingertips.
In my career, I have worked with some of the smartest, most successful people in the world. From my time as a software engineer at big companies like Microsoft and Amazon to my time as a Chief Technology Officer at successful startups like Moz and Decide, to sitting on boards of international organizations, I have seen one thing time and time again:
The most successful people in the world are always organized and put together.
They rely on targeted goals, smart planning, and deep, focused work to accomplish amazing things. I’ve learned so much about how to be amazing from these people, and now I want to share the proven system I have developed with you to help you be more successful too.
Last year, I launched a Kickstarter to produce a goal-setting and note-taking system called the Spark Notebook. We were able to share the notebooks with people all over the world - it was amazing to create something that made so many people more successful.
Now, I want to take the best planning tools from the Spark Notebook and give them to you in one full year-long planner that you can use to make 2016 your best year yet.
You don't need to be perfect or have superpowers to be successful. You just need the right tools. Anyone can be amazing. You can be amazing.

The Spark Planner is everything you need, to accomplish everything you want.
WHAT'S INSIDE THE SPARK PLANNER
Research has shown that people who write down their goals — and who review those goals regularly — have more success than those that don't.
Which is why I wanted to create a place where goal-setting could be beautifully simple and powerfully effective.
In The Spark Planner, you’ll find beautiful, simple, easy-to-use layouts that will help you stay on track every day, all day.
And we’re making a digital version of THE FULL SPARK PLANNER free to anyone who shares this project on social media! Get free access to every single beautiful page at the close of the campaign, just by sending a note with a screenshot or link to your social share to planner@sparknotebook.com
Share the Spark Notebook on Facebook!
Share the Spark Notebook on Twitter!
Take a look at the images below to get a feel of how beautiful (and functional) these pages are:
YEARLY THEME & ACHIEVEMENTS
Great things come to those who plan for them. Lay out your great plans and big dreams, and keep a record of what you achieve and when.
MONTHLY GOALS & 30-DAY CHALLENGES
Track your monthly goals and challenge yourself to create (or break) a habit. Success is *all* about consistency.
 MONTHLY CALENDARS
Monthly calendar spreads so you can keep track of all your important dates, reminders, and appointments.
WEEKLY GOALS & WEEKLY JOURNALING PROMPTS
Each week there is a place to recognize your progress, learn from your mistakes, and plan how you'll keep going. And of course plenty of blank, flex space to be used for your big thoughts and grand ideas.
WEEKLY OUTLOOK
A weekly outlook designed for time blocking - that way you can plan your day and always know you are working on something that matters.
HAND-CRAFTED AND ARTFULLY BOUND TO LIE FLAT NO MATTER WHAT
Each notebook is put together by hand. This isn't just a planner; it's also design, a craft, a work of art. We use a special binding so the planner lies flat, no matter what page you are on.
---
The Spark Planner has the following layouts:
Yearly Theme & Goals
Annual Achievement Tracker -so you can celebrate all the great things you do next year
Monthly Overview (12 months)
Monthly Goals (1 for each month)
30 Day Challenge (1 for each month)
Weekly Goals - prioritize and strategize so all of your work matters
Weekly Overview - designed for time blocking to help you make the most of every single day
Weekly Inspiration Prompts - these are designed to get you thinking, but also designed to be mostly blank so you can fill them with great ideas, fantastic drawings or plans for your next big thing.
In addition to the useful design, you’ll also discover these other great features:
Made in the USA. I’m proud to send something to you made in the country where I live.
Two-page markers. You’ll never have to worry about losing your place.
A luxurious and sophisticated cover. I want this planner to feel and look sophisticated so we have tested all kinds of cover materials and picked one we know you will love.
High quality, ink-proof, acid-free paper. No more ink bleeding through pages. Fountain pen safe (I’ve tested it myself!).
Special lay-flat binding. These books are hand-sewn and designed with a very special binding that allows you to write easily on every page - front and back.
Environmentally sound. We use soy based inks for printing. We use rainforest friendly paper. Everything is produced where we know the labor and manufacturing practices are to the same high standards as our products.
Over 250 pages. We have designed each page to be clean, simple and flexible. 
5.75” x 8.25” size. A perfect size for at your desk or in a meeting.
HOW TO GET A FREE DIGITAL SPARK PLANNER
I love this planner and I know that the tools within it will add value to anyone's life —  I want you to have access to all of that value, whether you are able to donate to the project or not.
And so, we have created a downloadable PDF of the entire digital version of the Spark Planner that you can get completely for free.
All you have to do is share our project on social media, send us a note at planner@sparknotebook.com with a screenshot or a link of where you shared it, and we will send you a PDF at the end of the Kickstarter campaign.
This planner is amazing, and I truly believe the tools inside it will help you be more successful; which is why I want to share it for free.
I want you to have all the benefits I’ve worked so hard to create in this planner, regardless of whether you are able to contribute to the project. You can get serious about your success, just by helping us share it.
Use one or both of the links below to get a pre-populated tweet or Facebook post shared directly from your account! Send an email of your share to planner@sparknotebook.com.
Share the Spark Notebook on Facebook!
Share the Spark Notebook on Twitter!

WHY I'M BUILDING YOU THE PERFECT PLANNER
During my entire career as an entrepreneur and executive, I've struggled to find a notebook that had the functionality I needed that I also wouldn't be embarrassed to carry into a board meeting.
It seemed like the only notebooks with goal-planners, journaling pages, and organization systems were bright pink and looked like a scrapbook. Not exactly what I was looking for to be taken seriously.
On the other hand, though, the sleek, modern notebooks I found lacked all functionality and served only as appointment books or calendars. They were just lined pages no system for notes from plans from goals.
The search for the perfect, professional notebook left me wondering: Why is it so hard to find a notebook with tons of functionality and a beautiful, professional design?

So I built my own. I launched the Spark Notebook as a Kickstarter last year. Once the notebooks were delivered to thousands of people across the globe, feedback came pouring in.
I heard again and again from users who wished for two things:
A full year of pages
Fewer notes pages and more planning pages
I listened, and that's exactly what I want to give you with the Spark Planner. Tons of functionality, a full year of amazing planning and goals, and no distractions from your biggest dreams and accomplishments.

YOU WANT A SPARK PLANNER. PLEDGE NOW TO GET YOURS!
With the Spark Planner, you can achieve any goal. You can make anything happen.
Accomplishing amazing things isn't about being superhuman. It's not about being perfect. It's about having the right tools, the right system, and the right plan.
The Spark Planner helps you put all those things right in one place, and a place that's so artfully designed you'll want to have it with you all the time — and your coworkers will ask you where they can get one too.
No more wishing you could accomplish more every day, or feeling at the end of the year like you could have done more if you'd only worked harder.
With the Spark Planner, you can look any goal in the face and know you'll achieve it. You'll look back on every year and be amazed by what you've accomplished. 
I want you — and your ideas — to be heard. I want you to walk into your next meeting as the person everyone else wants to listen to, the person so organized and on top of things that everyone turns to you first. I want you to get more from your career and the time you spend at work.
I want you to do everything you want to do. I want you to wow your boss, coworkers, and clients with how incredibly productive and effective you are. I want you to feel proud and accomplished. And I know the Spark Planner can help you get there.
If you want that too — if you want 2016 to be your best year yet — then please pledge now so we can build The Spark Planner and make being achieving your goals in 2016 a beautiful reality.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk with any crowdfunding campaign involving a physical item is manufacturing and shipping. The good news is - I've done this before. 

I have been working with my printers for months to get the best possible materials and most timely shipping methods possible for these products.

I want you to have this planner to kick off 2016, so you can start the new year on the right track. The biggest risk for us, then, is that your notebook might be late.

Problems may come up (they always do...) but the vendors I am working with have a history of producing quality products on time. It's their job, and they do it well.

I guarantee you will get your planners, and I will do everything in my power (up to and including hopping on a plane and heading to the printer myself) to get yours to you on time so you can start using them as soon as possible. 

I can back up what I say here — when my Kickstarter for the Spark Notebook was delayed at the fulfillment center, I had all 5,000 notebooks shipped to my house, where I packed and mailed them myself. And I'm prepared to do it again, if I have to. I am committed to getting these planners and notebooks out to all of my customers on time.

If problems do come up or you aren’t happy with your planner, I promise to do everything I can to make it right. I want you to love your notebook, and if you don’t, I want to fix that.

I am committed to being transparent and open during this whole process. If there are any issues, you’ll hear about them and you’ll hear how I am going to fix them. My number one goal is to get an amazing product in your hands as soon as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

“What the heck am I doing with my life?” This was the question I asked myself while caught in a period of directionless floating. In 2013, I had just graduated from UCLA, and I had no idea what I wanted to do next. After a dark period of depression, I realized I wasn’t the only person facing this problem. I knew something needed to change. Life was too short to keep thinking “what if.”
I thought about what was the most productive and fulfilling times in my life, and I realized I always had a trusty sidekick, my planner. I searched from the perfect planner, but it didn’t exist. So, I made my own.
I designed a planner that not only helps you plan your daily life, but also helps you define and chase what you want out of life.
We launched it on Kickstarter, and it became a viral phenomenon. In what felt like overnight, I went from working in my parents' garage, to a warehouse with a full staff.
Why another Kickstarter?
I started this company wanting to give the world a tool that I wish existed when I was feeling lost. 
From day one, we have offered the PDF for anyone to use for free; we launched our Pay-it-Forward program, a program that allows people pay a planner forward to a stranger in need at half the cost; and we've given thousands of Passion Planners to 84 non-profits all around the country.
But we want to do more.
Now, on our two year anniversary, Passion Planner is taking one of our biggest steps forward. Today, through Kickstarter, we are becoming a Get-1-Give-1 Company.
Every time you purchase a Passion Planner we are going to give one to someone in need. When you invest in yourself, you will also be investing in the dreams of someone else.
Here’s to helping more people, together.
Questions? Email us at support@passionplanner.com
Passion Planner is a paper planner designed with your passions and personal goals in mind. It seamlessly balances functionality, personal reflection and goal setting in one beautiful handcrafted planner.
Inner Pages:
Annual goal setting guide to help you brainstorm, define, and create actions for your goals your lifetime, 3 year, 1 year, and one month goals.
Weekly layouts (Sunday - Monday) that run from January 2016 - December 2016
Annual and monthly overview calendars
Monthly check in reflection questions to get you thinking about progress, gratitude and steps for improvement
20 Additional blank pages
20 Additional gridded pages
Weekly Layouts:
Weekly and daily focuses where you can ask yourself “what is the most important thing that needs to get done?” today or this week.
A Sunday - Monday appointment calendar that runs from 6 AM – 11 PM broken down into 30 minute increments
Good Things That Happened section to keep you focused and looking for the positive in every week.
A motivational quote and a matching challenge to encourage you translate those words into positive action
Dual personal and work to do lists organized by priority to encourage personal and work life balance because all too often we get caught up in work and put our personal needs on the back burner
Space of Infinite Possibility where you can take notes, draw, journal, brainstorm or customize to your needs of the week.
Outer Specs:
Soft and durable faux leather cover; animal and vegan friendly!
Super smooth high quality 100 gsm thick paper, about twice as thick as a standard sheet of printer paper to resist ink bleeding from fountain pens
Available in two sizes: Classic (8.5" x 11") and Compact (5.5" x 8.5")
The Classic (8.5" x 11") and Compact (5.5" x 8.5")
Sleek, more streamlined layout.
New "People To See" and "Places To Go" sections!
The "Not To-Do List" section!
 Monthly Layout:
People To See + Places To Go lists: Define where and with who you want to spend your time.
Not To-Do List: Help define and refrain from bad habits that are holding you back from your goals.
Week numbers to help you keep track of upcoming deadlines and keep the year in perspective.
We feel that anyone should be able to use it regardless of their financial ability. That’s why we continue to share it for free.
Shoot a message to pdf.passionplanner@gmail.com with proof that you've shared this Kickstarter page (i.e. screenshot or direct link) and we will send you the full PDF of Passion Planner 2016 when our Kickstarter ends for you to download, print and use to pursue your dreams.

Customize it to your needs. Whether you are a recent grad who feels a little lost and is in need of some direction and inspiration, or a professional looking to balance work, family and you passions, this planner is structured to be tailored to your needs.
Follow your passions. Short and long-term goal setting activities, weekly to-do lists and monthly check-ins keep you focused and remind you of your goals.
Get focused. Weekly and daily focus sections allow you to target and focus on what is most important.
Do you. Separated and prioritized to-do lists for personal and work tasks because all too often we tend to mix work with our personal lives and put our personal needs on the back burner.
Declutter. A physical notebook allows you to empty your thought onto paper and declutter your mind, enabling you to visualize your goals and focus more on the present.
Challenge yourself. Weekly challenges give you the opportunity to challenge yourself to positively influence your life.
Look at the big picture. Complete annual and monthly calendars allow you to get a bird's eye view of your year and months so you can plan ahead and stay organized.
Manage your time. A daily appointment calendar allows you to easily keep track of how you spend your time.
Create a keepsake. High quality materials ensure that you can enjoy your planner, ideas, memories, and reflections for years to come.
Stay positive. Inspirational quotes and "Good Things That Happened" sections keep you motivated and focused on your progress.

campaign.story:
Click the green button to order a Basics Notebook!
Get Your Project Funded Today!
  In October of last year we launched the BASICS Wallet (pictured above) here on Kickstarter, and with the help of 6,000 people just like you, we were able to raise $170,000 to bring the BASICS Wallet to life. The wallet now sales on our website at www.basicswallet.com. Check it out! We are excited to introduce the 2nd product in the Basics family, the BASICS Notebook!
When discussing this idea with friends and family we were often asked, "Why a Notebook? Isn't that a step backward in technology?". To this question we responded that the notebook is not a step back, but instead a tool to be used in tandem with modern technology to keep your life moving forward in the right direction.
So Why a Notebook?
 During our first Kickstarter, we noticed very quickly that our notebooks were crucial for accomplishing goals, tasks, notes from business meetings, drawing prototype ideas, brainstorming, and to just keep the project moving forward. It was nice to have everything in one place and be able to have access to it anywhere and anytime. However, with all of the notebooks we went through we couldn’t find one that accomplished everything we needed and covered every aspect of our lives. One notebook that would allow us to plan, set goals, provided pages for notes, and blank pages for drawing and sketching. 
 We developed different layouts that we tested on our own and then passed on to others for feedback. After receiving feedback we finalized the design and have loved what we have come up with, and we know you will too. 
 It has been interesting to see what we have been able to accomplish by setting goals and taking action. We have all been taught this principle before… "You will never succeed if you don’t try". Making your dreams into realities requires that you take that first step of setting goals and making plans. What better way to do this than with a pen and paper? 
 To us, there is no replacement to the feeling of planning, brain storming and taking notes, with a good old fashion pen and paper. However there is nothing old fashioned about this notebook. We have countless innovations and page layouts that will both simplify and improve your life. Lets take a Look!
             Share Our Project and Get a Free PDF Copy of Our Monthly and Weekly Layout!  Here's How it Works:
We want to spread the word so that The BASICS Notebook can help as many people as possible.  In order to get your free PDF copy, click the green button below to follow these two simple steps:
Thanks for your support!  We will email your free PDF within 2 weeks of our Kickstarter Campaign end date.  If you also want to purchase the actual notebook, check out the innovative features below and select a reward level above.
 Thanks to everyone's support we are able to make the notebook even better! Here are some stretch goals that we will apply to each reward level if we hit the specified funding goal! Help us spread the word and hit these funding goals so that we can make this an even better Notebook!
 Grid Dot Paper - We will add a new option on each reward level for a black notebook in the 12 and 6 month version that replaces the lined paper for grid dot paper. (Only available in black). 
Pen - We will include one pen for each notebook. 
New Color - Every new color requires a very large quantity to be purchased but if we hit $500k, then we will introduce a new color based on feedback we receive. If we hit $500k we will send out a survey to ask for your color choice.
 Perforated Pages - We will perforate the last 15 pages of the lined paper section and the last 5 pages of the blank page section.
The BASICS Notebook is hard cover and made of a high quality faux leather that just gets better over time. The notebook is available in two colors, black and mint, giving both men and women the option to choose whatever color they like best. We have used a high grade thick elastic to hold your notebook closed. You're going to love the way this notebook feels.
Pen Holder
How many times have you thought, "I should write that down, no, I can remember" and one hour later poof... Its gone. Now you can capture inspiration and important thoughts in the moment, and never be lost without the tools you need to write it down. 
By lowering the height of the pages in the notebook by just 0.3" inches, we have created the perfect place to securely store your pen or pencil.
The Pen Stored in the Notebook
Double Elastics
The first dual elastic notebook of its kind: 
The thicker elastic is designed to hold the notebook shut, and it also holds the pen in place as explained above. 
 The thinner elastic is designed to be used as a bookmark in the calendar so that you can easily turn to the right page every time you open the notebook. 
These elastics also work together to help the notebook stay open. Perfect for reading, typing, or on windy days.
Lays Flat
While the elastics help, we have designed our notebook so that it lays flat without the aid of the elastics.
Back Pocket
We have added a pocket on the inside of the back cover allowing you to store important papers and documents. Each notebook will come with 2 pages of whiteboard paper (see feature below), which will be placed in this pocket to give you room to do some brainstorming. A great place for creative thinking.
White Board Pages
When working in groups, drawing, or if you just have something that you want to jot down, you can use the 2 whiteboard pages found in the back pocket of the notebook and easily erase everything when you are ready to move onto the next brainstorming session.
 While all of the exterior features of the notebook simplify your life, it's the inside of the notebook that is really going to help improve your life.
We have designed The BASICS Notebook with the best materials inside and out. Inside the notebook we used eco-friendly 80g ivory paper. The notebook comes available in two options, a 12 month and 6 month planner.  Here is a breakdown of what is in each of these two options followed by the quantity of pages in each layout:
Each notebook has a total of 220 pages, giving you a notebook thickness that is comfortable and convenient.  Below you will see the number of each type of pages in each of these two options, the 12 month and 6 month notebooks:
 Pricing
Both the 12 and 6 month notebooks are sold at the same price.  Once the Kickstarter Campaign ends we will send out a survey asking you which type of notebook you would like.  If you pledge at the one notebook level you will be able to choose the 12 or 6 month planner.  If you buy any reward level that offers multiple notebooks you will be able to choose any combination of 12 month or 6 month notebooks you want.
Here is a rundown of what the monthly and weekly layouts look like and how they can be used. Find the colored section you are curious about in the monthly and weekly layout sections below and read the corresponding description below the image.
Click the link below to see a digital copy of the 6 month notebook:
Click the link above to see a digital copy of the 6 month notebook
Monthly Layout:
A ) 3 Daily Tasks – Fill out three things you want to do on a daily basis and check the box each day that you do that activity (i.e. exercising, personal study, planning, etc...). This will give you visibility on how well you are performing these tasks on a daily and monthly basis.
B ) Notes – Two notes sections are provided for you to use however you want. There is always something that needs to be written down.
C ) Monthly Focus – Select something that you would like to focus on this month in order to improve (i.e. budgeting, meeting new people, eating healthy, or any other positive activity).
D ) Monthly Calendar – We have given you an open calendar where you can add any dates you want. This gives you the flexibility to use the calendar whenever you want rather than having a notebook that will expire. Here you can get a big picture view of your entire month, and never miss another meeting, appointment, or party. We will provide a yearly calendar with the notebook so that you have easy access to the dates anywhere you have your notebook. 
E ) Goals ---> Tasks – Here we have provided room to write down your 3 most pressing goals for the month. Then connected to each goal are three lines to list three smaller tasks that will need to be completed in order to achieve that goal. This activity forces you to break down big daunting goals into smaller and more digestible tasks to ensure that you know what to do on a weekly basis to accomplish your goals.
Weekly Layout:
A ) Notes – Two notes sections are provided for you to use however you want. There is always something that needs to be written down.
B ) Weekly Layout – The weekly layout gives you an hourly break down of the 7 days of the week with 1 line for each hour between 6am - 10pm. For early morning, lunch, or late night activities, we have added an extra blank space before 6am, right after 12pm, and right after 10pm. Assign these hours to fit your needs. Just like with the monthly calendar, we have given you an open weekly calendar where you can add any dates you want. This gives you the flexibility to use the calendar whenever you want rather than having a notebook that will expire. We will provide a yearly calendar with the notebook so that you have easy access to the dates anywhere you have your notebook.
C ) Activity – Research has shown that happy and positive people are more productive, have higher income, demonstrate superior performance, and overall are more successful. So let’s focus on this and create opportunities to foster a more positive outlook on life. Each week you will find a new optional activity that will help you become more positive and optimistic in your day to day tasks. Which in turn will make you more successful.
D ) Daily Priorities (Checklists) – Jot down your most important to-do’s for the day here and check them off to ensure you don’t forget anything.
E ) Goals ---> Tasks – This is the same exercise as shown in letter “E” in the monthly layout above, but gives you the space to make weekly goals. This activity forces you to break down big daunting goals into smaller and more digestible tasks to ensure that you know what to do on a daily basis to accomplish your goals. Again taking your big picture goals and dreams and helping you turn them into smaller actionable tasks.
We collaborated with Kirk Wilkinson, author of "The Happiness Factor" and "I Am Strong" to create 30 unique activities to boost positivity and increase productivity. 
Researchers have found that people who have a consistent practice of expressing gratitude report having more intense and frequent positive emotions. Grateful people have more energy, are more productive, are healthier, handle change better, report feeling hopeful and more empathetic, are less materialistic and are more forgiving. 
 Expressing gratitude brings additional benefits of creating stronger relationships, the ability to deal with difficult situations and trauma better, reduces the need to compare yourself with others and allows you to see to good in others and the good around you. Gratitude can change your life!
 “Gratitude is a potent cure-all for negative emotions,” Says Kirk Wilkinson a world-renowned expert in personal happiness and personal development and bestselling author of two books:The Happiness Factor: How to be Happy no Matter What! and I Am Strong: The Formula to Improve your Self-Worth. 
Here are examples of 2 of the 30 unique activities that will be found on the weekly layouts:
Take a picture of something you are grateful for and post that picture to social media explaining why you are grateful.
Write a hand written note to someone who has made a positive difference in your life and deliver it to the person.
Get a jump start on your own personal happiness with Kirk Wilkinson and develop the practice of expressing gratitude by downloading The Happiness Factor iPhone App by texting ‘happy’ to 878787 or Click here.  You can learn more about Kirk Wilkinson at learnhappiness.com.
The Notebook was designed to be very versatile and used by anyone in any situation.  Whether you are a business executive, starting a new job, a mother, a father, a student, or any other role, The BASICS Notebook will help you navigate through the obstacles and challenges that we all face.  Our hope is that The BASICS Notebook will make your life easier and more manageable giving you time to accomplish your dreams and improve your life.  We can’t wait to see what you accomplish with the help of The BASICS notebook.
Timeline
Our current projections put the delivery date of the notebooks in November of 2015.  As always, there are potential complications that could arise to delay this delivery date, however with this being our second Kickstarter campaign, we already have all of the logistics and relationships in place in order to ensure a smooth and on time delivery.  We will be sure to keep you updated if any changes take place.
The BASICS Team
Meet cousins, Jon Richards and Jacob Durham. We have a strong passion for developing great products and introducing them into the market with a hope to help other people simplify their lives and get back to the BASICS. We hope that you enjoy our products and would welcome any feedback or input you might have. If you want to learn more about us and our other products please visit www.basicswallet.com
Jacob Durham & Jon Richards (Founders of Basics Products)

campaign.story:
It is time to summon the greatest do-able vegan cookbook of all time.
This will be an ultra visual, multimedia cookbook to teach amazing vegan cooking with a fist full of metal.
Each and every recipe in the book will have an accompanying video.  You will be able to scan a QR code to summon the video for anything in the book.
I want this to be the most fun vegan cookbook  possible that teaches easy vegan cooking in a modern real world context.
Since I am also highly into personal development and mysticism... The book will be peppered with the most useful aspects of what I have learned from that world as well.
I am not really into cookbooks.
I don't like measuring shit, I don't like rigid rules, and I don't like people telling me what to do.
This cookbook is made for the person that does not like to use cookbooks in mind.  
First, The book is concept based.  You learn a concept, see one full write-up (with pictures every step along the way) on how to use that concept (the recipes).  Then you are shown many ideas for dishes that can be made using variations of the same concept.
For example, with the concept of mixing vegenase (vegan mayo), vinegar and spices many things can be made. You are shown a full write-up on how to make vegan ranch dressing.  Then taking the same concept, you are shown briefly how to make cole slaw, potato salad, jackfruit chickun salad, eggless egg salad etc.  

Of course, there is a video for each and every one of those.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
First of all, I minimize some challenges to completion by creating every aspect of the book (besides layout). I write all the music used in the videos. I made the videos. It is just Me and a tripod. I write everything and do the photography for everything. 

This eliminates potential conflicts of rights arguments. 

I am working with a reliabable publisher for the printing of the book. The publisher is publishing the French translation of the cookbook while allowing me to go through them for a great cost on the printing of the english version. 

This publisher L'Age D'Homme publishes the french translation of many top selling vegan cookbooks such as Veganomicon, Isa Does it, and Thug Kitchen. That means they know what they are doing and work with the best. 

December should be a good amount of time for the fulfillment of these books and rewards. That is well within the lead time told to me by the publisher. If there are delays I will see what alternate routes I can take in getting the kickstarter rewards fulfilled in another way. Worse comes to worse, print on demand. 

If an incredible amount of books are ordered. I will enlist the aid of my current fulfillment house to help fulfill the orders and handle customer service. Of course I will always be available to deal with any issues that may arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What is Create and Orchestrate?
Create And Orchestrate is my first book, designed to help simplify entrepreneurship for those looking to take control of their time and money while making an impact in their community. My name is Marcus Whitney.
This book and the company I have just founded to bring it to you (more on that below) is brought to you in partnership with the creative team at Mountain. You'll notice they are hosting this Kickstarter as well.
There are three things Create and Orchestrate will do for its reader:
The reader who lacks the courage necessary to start and run a business will be greatly encouraged, and learn why the entrepreneur is a vital role in our society. 
 The reader who doesn’t understand how to be a founder will become clear on the principles and practices a founder should have to be a strong leader. 
 The reader who has never started or run a business will become aware of what to do when starting and running a business. I want Create and Orchestrate to re-ignite a fire in America, the idea that innovation and enterprise will come from everywhere in this country. 
What we need is more shots on goal. And while business books are continually being written for the initiated few, I am writing this one for the uninitiated many.
Here is what you can expect to find in this book:
The simple way to embrace the mindset of a founder. 
 Stories from many unlikely entrepreneurs who bucked the odds and as a result did well for themselves and their community. 
The straight-forward blueprint for going from an idea to an operating business. 
A discussion (since there is no one right way) about the different approaches to growing your team and your business. 
A true demystification of business finance and operations (the thing that most of us get hung up on).
I believe that:
Entrepreneurship is a mindset and a way of doing things that everyone can learn. It is a skill, like swimming. Even though some people have more natural ability in it, the mindset and way of doing can be taught. 
Entrepreneurship can help you solve problems that traditional approaches can not. 
Through entrepreneurship, you can beat the odds of economic immobility for your family AND make a positive impact in your community. 
Because of these beliefs, and my first hand experience both being an entrepreneur and mentoring over 100 entrepreneurs, I'm writing a book to help develop a new wave of unlikely entrepreneurs, in hopes that they will mobilize in their communities and provide innovative solutions to the most pressing issues we face. 
The issue I'm addressing is Income Inequality. I want to help more people make more money and control more of their time so they can be better wives, husbands, mothers, fathers and members of their communities. 
Help me do that by pre-ordering Create and Orchestrate. 
Thank you so much for your support of Create and Orchestrate and The Unlikely Company. We hit our first goal, which pushes us forward on creating the book. We are now looking to fund our first initiative. As you know, I want to create 1000 unlikely entrepreneurs. I believe this will happen through a variety of efforts. I believe Create and Orchestrate will create many of them, but I also believe that grassroots efforts in our communities will be key to this goal as well. To that end, I am partnering with the Oasis Center in Nashville to launch an after school, social enterprise accelerator program called Oasis Venture.
This program will teach 20 high school students how to launch a social enterprise so that they can address the needs of their community sustainably. They also will be learning the basics of being an entrepreneur which will be a life skill they can use in many more endeavors throughout their lives.
This program will cost around $45K at a base. I am hoping to provide $30K of this funding from The Unlikely Company as part of our double bottom line commitment. If we can get to $100K in pledges than we can do that. The big number I want to see grow from here is the number of pledges.
Let's get 1000 pledges in the next 20 days. I know we can do it. Thanks for all your support and belief.
- Marcus
My name is Marcus Whitney, and I want to make the world a better place by developing “the unlikely entrepreneurs.”
My job as President of Jumpstart Foundry is to predictably launch successful startups in the Healthcare industry by educating, mentoring and investing in entrepreneurs. As a serial entrepreneur myself, I’ve been involved in the creation of almost 60 businesses over the last 5 years. This all started because in 2007 I left Emma Email Marketing where I led technology to start a business. Once I was on my own, I found out just how much I didn’t know about starting a business.
Out of pure stubbornness, I pushed through failure after failure until I developed a solid understanding of what it takes to launch and sustain a business. On my journey, I became fortunate to become known in some circles as someone who can mentor beginner entrepreneurs. In speaking with these founders, I found they usually were in need of two things:
a mindset that would give them the courage needed to be bold, and to endure during the inevitable tough times ahead. 
 a comprehensive base of knowledge about how a business operates and how you get one started
Then I started to look a bit deeper into who was reaching out to me and why. Yes, they were looking for mentorship and yes, I do that for a living. But a pattern emerged for me last year. Many people were coming to me to hear my story, not just to hear me tell them what to do. And I think part of why they were coming to hear my story is that it was kind of ‘unlikely’ that a guy like me (African American, college drop out) would be in the position I’m in.
Leading technology teams and making venture capital investment decisions aren’t typically things done by people like me. In fact, it’s not just me, the majority of people in America don’t actually fit the profile of today’s innovative entrepreneur. That is a big problem, and here’s why.
The accumulation and concentration of wealth in America happens in three primary ways:
Inheritance, Investment and Entrepreneurship
Just check the Forbes top 25 richest Americans and you’ll see that this is how most of them got there. And the vast majority of new entrants come as entrepreneurs. Gates, Zuckerberg, Page, Ellison, Bloomberg, Brin, Bezos & Dell. All mega powerful, all entrepreneurs. Also, all very similar demographically.
As the lower class, women, minorities, new Americans and others seek to balance the scales of power and representation in America, the most powerful approach available to them (us) is entrepreneurship. Yet that is not what we are being encouraged to do. I am working to change that.
I learned about the power of entrepreneurship from my mother.
She didn’t become rich from the business she started while I was in middle school and high school, but she did control her time, hire her friends and made sure that her work supported her life and not the other way around. I was lucky to have her show me that I could control my life and realize my dreams through entrepreneurship. For many, they don’t have those examples.
I learned after I gave my TEDxNashville Talk on Hustling, that people can draw inspiration from the stories of others, even stories from people like me. I was rocked when person after person told me that this talk had changed their life, and that they were believing in themselves in a way they hadn’t done before. I learned that I could make an impact just by sharing my story and what I’ve learned.
And two years later, after more keynotes, more failures, and some successes, I’ve seen little change in the world overall. Except, the gap between the haves and the have-nots is bigger than ever. The examples of diverse entrepreneurs are still few and far between with very few new entrants. And the impact of wealth on our most critical systems like politics, education and criminal justice, continues to tip things in favor of the rich.
Ok, fine.
It’s time to help the rest of us focus on getting rich then. The unlikely ones.
You might be an ‘unlikely’ entrepreneur if:
you are ambitious you are creative you are a little bit of a REBEL
and…
you are in the lower, to lower-middle class or you are a woman or minority or you didn’t finish college (or maybe even high school)
If so, listen up. I’m starting a new company dedicated to helping you become an entrepreneur. Unlike many people in the startup space who are saying there are too many entrepreneurs, I couldn’t disagree more. 
We need more entrepreneurs.
We need more artists to become entrepreneurs. 
We need more activists to become entrepreneurs. 
We need more educators to become entrepreneurs. 
We need more people who love people and want to help people to become entrepreneurs.
That is why I, with my mother Isabel Whitney, have launched The Unlikely Company, PBC.
You may not have seen a company before that has PBC at the end. PBC stands for Public Benefit Corporation. What this basically means is that even though The Unlikely Company is a for profit corporation (S Corp to the IRS), it is in our charter that we exist for the purpose of providing a public benefit or public good. I believe in this structure for companies seeking to do good in the world because it means the company can maintain a profit motive for its own sustainability (as opposed to dependence on donations), but is committed to doing good at its foundation.
The Unlikely Company exists to develop, mentor and eventually invest in the Unlikely Entrepreneurs.
We are committed to transparency and at present, our business model is to commit 30% of our net profits to initiatives that will achieve our mission. You can learn more about our business model here.
Our first product is why you are here.
I want to write the book that gets you at least 80% of the way there. The book that I wish I had when I got started. A book where I could look inside and read stories about people who I could identify with. A book that turns a steep learning curve into a bunny hill. A book with wisdom, inspiration and simple guidance on how to start and run a business. And, a book that speaks to you as the founder, about your important role in this process.
I want to bring you, Create and Orchestrate.
I have become overwhelmed by how convoluted the topic of entrepreneurship has become. What I believe is needed are stories that will resonate and stick with people, as well as simple and clear directions on a very complicated topic. 
I expect to have to spend time, money and other resources to gather the stories and do the research necessary for this book to make an impact. Also, there will be production costs, design, editing etc. It's going to be my first book and I want to make it worth the time you would invest in reading it. 
So, let's go a little deeper. 
This is a pre-order for a book. If we hit the goal, I'm gonna do everything in my power to deliver that book. However, as a pre-order, I'm going to handle the money as I would with any purchase made through The Unlikely Company. Rather than allocate a dollar amount (because I want to go way beyond this goal), I'll share how the money will be allocated. The more money raised, the better the end product will be.
I will invest 20% of the money for travel expenses to capture stories and information for the book. 
Another 20% will go to Mountain who is managing all aspects of my marketing, multi-media production, design and my primary collaborator on strategy. They also are managing the fulfillment of rewards, so they are pretty important.
30% will fund The Unlikely Company's operations. That's mostly my time and our operating costs. 
And the final 30% will be directed towards The Unlikely Company's commitment to Public Good. Our direct impact. 
30% of The Unlikely Company's net profits go to public good. Our first initiative will set out to develop Unlikely Social Entrepreneurs in Nashville. Average age: 16 years old. 
We are thrilled to partner with the Oasis Center in Nashville to launch "Oasis Venture", an after-school social enterprise accelerator for Nashville's most vulnerable and disconnected youth. We believe introducing entrepreneurship to children during their high school years, as well as the principles of Social Enterprise, will be an empowering experience for all. 
We also believe that there is the potential for true innovation to emerge from this program that can take root in Nashville's most challenged neighborhoods. 
STRETCH GOAL:
While Oasis Center is seeking funding along side of The Unlikely Company's commitment, we would like to fully fund the venture as soon as possible. The program will require ~$40K to operate. So our super stretch goal is to hit $100K in this campaign so that we can commit $30K to fund the program. 
NOTE: $30K is more than 30% net profit on $100K revenue (net profit means what's left after we pay all the bills) , but if we hit the stretch goal we will go beyond our normal double bottom line commitment. 
In the first reward level, you'll find access to the E-book, the first print edition, custom Create And Orchestrate merchandise and updates from me not only during the campaign, but during the process of further researching and writing the book itself.
The Create and Orchestrate brand (as well as my new personal brand and The Unlikely Company brand) were designed by the ultra talented Stephen Jones. Stephen is an entrepreneur that I admire because of his commitment to integrity in every thing he designs. He absolutely nailed our brands and we are proud to offer a limited edition T-Shirt for our community to represent our mission in the world.
The sold out crowd at CHARGE 2014 in Nashville.
In level 2, I'm including ways backers can also get engaged in the annual conference I produce with Jumpstart Foundry and Mountain called CHARGE. CHARGE is all about the story. Last year's kick off event in Nashville sold out and we heard seven incredible, authentic backstories from entrepreneurs of all types.
Jeni Britton Bauer explain how she built an Ice Cream empire and stayed true to herself. We heard James Ellis from Athletics explain how not knowing what you're doing at first is just fine. The important part is that you decide to do it anyway. We heard from Clint Smith on how he built Emma and how Bailey Spaulding is growing a unique brewery in Nashville. We heard quite a bit more as well.
This year, CHARGE is already looking to be bigger and better. It will sell out again, no doubt. At this backer level you can secure a spot at the November 2016 event. You can also secure a very limited VIP pass which includes a night before dinner with myself, Jumpstart Foundry, Mountain and any available speakers. 
I strongly urge you to engage at this level. There is nothing like learning from these stories first hand.
Me introducing a speaker at CHARGE in 2014
At our final backer level, I'm offering not only the first edition of Create And Orchestrate but a couple options for a one-on-one experience with me. These range from a 30 minute Skype conference to a full day, in person strategy and design session with me. I'll even fly to you if you're not near me (as long as you are in the US)! 
If you're idea or your company is at the right place for this kind of in-depth face to face help, then these rewards are for you.

I appreciate you, and I thank you for your pledge. This is a work of passion and conviction, a calling. Your pledge is vital to my ability to do this, far beyond money. It's confirmation and validation. So thank you. 
Thank you to the Unlikely ones who trudge ahead in this world in spite of all the odds against you. You are inspiration enough for me to do all I can to support you. Hell, I'm one of you.

It was a pretty wild ride from start to finish (might even make a good book someday), and we all went our separate ways doing a wide variety of projects and vocations, reuniting occasionally in the 90s to bash it around a bit more.
Last Promo Shot of Band, 1991
But, unlike so many groups who have been through similar experiences, we have stayed close friends ever since, And when circumstances brought Ross Rice (vocals, keyboards, lyrics) back to Nashville in late 2014 where the other band members Kye Kennedy (guitar, vocals), Peter Hyrka (violin, guitar, vocals), Steve Arnold (bass, vocals), and Steve Ebe (drums, vocals) resided, there was simply no good reason not to continue the musical conversation started over 20 years before.
We started hanging out again, created new tunes generated from just playing together again. There is an undeniable chemistry afoot here. And now we are thinking....well, let's record it, get it out there somehow. And lo and behold, here is the beautiful new concept of "crowdfunding."
So we are asking for your donation, and here is what we intend to do with the money. We have started the project already out of pocket....we will use this money to pay for studio time to complete overdubs, mix and master the final product, pay for a CD and vinyl run with artwork and booklet, and all shipping and postage getting them to donors and press/radio.
After that, we hope to use additional funds to finish building our website, and then we want to secure a suitable venue for an evening, get a bunch of cool lights, a good sound system, and a roomful of good friends, and live record a series of videos in either Memphis or Nashville (possibly both.)
The budget we have worked out covers the expenses for all of this, with just a little padding. Additional funds will go to helping us get the music further out, to help the band get to locations yet unperformed!
Caricature by Michael Maness
 Thank you very much for any and all support making this music and subsequent performances happen!
Human Radio at Joe Pisapia's Studio, 2015
Please enjoy a brief taste from our archives...."Me & Elvis" from a live Rock 103 broadcast on Beale St. Memphis, 1989...the original pre-CD ska version. Thanks for your interest!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The only challenges we might face once funded have to do with how we are received by the public at large. Will our old fans like the band's new material, the differentiation of sound? Will new fans be interested in a bunch of 50-something year old guys trying to bash about, singing about god-knows-what? Is there any relevance to what we are trying to do? We are trying to take a rock 'n' roll attitude about it now, no point in chasing modern trends and fashions. We sound like exactly like ourselves, and nobody else does!



At the end of the day, though, none of that really matters. This is a band of serious survivors, we have all made it through an array of professional hells, not all of them musical. And we have nothing to lose....not trying for the brass ring of big label deal, mass acceptance and success. It's kinda cliche, but we are in it for the love of playing the music again, finding our fans and friends out there. And we always find a way to make it happen when we love it.

Are you ready to start your next adventure?
With a 3 x 5 inch Titanium bound notepad with weatherproof pages and an elastic band closure, you’ll be ready to take your next trip anywhere. Put it in your pocket as your bike in the woods, or store it in your backpack when you hike your next mountain. With the tpad EXPLORER, you’ll be prepared for your next adventure.
This tpad is built for those who need durability.
Please see full specs and available options at the bottom.
Do you find yourself struck with an idea only to find it slipping away as you search for a surface to write it on? With 5 x 7 inch Grade 5 Titanium bound tpad you’ll be able to quickly write down your ideas. And, because this tpad is made from the sturdy titanium, you’ll be able to write without struggling against flimsy surface. Bring the tpad INVENTOR on a train, to a concert or anywhere you are when the next great idea hits you. Refill with a large selection of pages.
Please see full specs and available options at the bottom.
With a 6 x 9.5 inch tpad JOURNAL you'll be able to write down how you felt at the most important events in your life. It's larger pages allow you to write down every detail you want to remember and refill it when you run out of space.
Please see full specs and available options at the bottom.
How to find a refill at a store
PLAY

Whether it’s spilled coffee or the every-day wear, the legendary strength of the feather light Titanium in an tpad can withstand accidents that life throws at you.
Regular notebooks are flimsy, temporary and easily damaged.
tpads are made with a material used for space rockets and bulletproof shields, so your pages stay safe between Titanium plates until you are ready to use them.
Because of the legendary strength of the Grade 5 Titanium (the strongest metal in the world by weight), you’ll be able to write down your notes wherever you go and on every surface.
Unlock the Titanium Spring Lock (see picture above), open your tpad and refill it using pages from a huge selection of existing notebooks on the market. We follow industry standards so you can easily find notebooks compatible with your tpad. You can also make your own custom pages using common binding equipment found in many offices.
PLAY

Grade 5 Titanium Spiral Coil with a Grade 5 Titanium Lock converts a standard spiral notepad (left picture) into a Titanium notepad (right picture). All "E" series tcoils use 3:1 hole standard, the most common standard used throughout the industry (3 holes per each inch). If your spiral notepad uses this standard (most of them do), you can replace the original spring with our tcoil to create your own Titanium notepad.
The size of tcoil is specified by the length of the paper (coil direction) and the holding capacity in pages (approximate number of standard thickness pages).
$30,000
tpad EXPLORER will ship with a separate refill of paper. We don't want to thicken the design of this model, it is a pocket tpad. When you finish the original set of pages, just refill in under a minute.
tpad INVENTOR will ship more pages (from the original 160 pages to 320 pages) and larger tcoil to accommodate a thicker tpad. If you want to keep your tpad lighter, just remove some pages. It is, after all, a refillable notepad -- use as many pages as you want.
tpad JOURNAL will ship with more pages (from the original 200 pages to 400 pages) and larger tcoil to accommodate a thicker tpad. If you want to keep your tpad lighter, just remove some pages. It is, after all, a refillable notepad -- use as many pages as you want.
We manufacture covers for tpads from pure Grade 5 Titanium, the revolutionary material typically reserved for space missions and bullet proof shields of advanced weapons.
Such amazing performance does not come cheap. The price of Grade 5 Titanium is 10 times higher than already very expensive aircraft grade aluminum. Titanium rings sell on average of $130 to $350; we could make 12 Titanium rings from the material we use in the smallest 3 x 5 inch tpads; the covers of larger tpads use considerably more material.
The cost of the material is just the beginning. The problem with manufacturing anything in Titanium, the strongest of all metals (by weight), is that conventional tools simply break apart when one attempts to use them for cutting Titanium. The most advanced methods, like laser cutting, face extreme challenges when dealing with an amazing hardness of Titanium.
So we need to move to nono-scale technologies removing individual atoms of Titanium to create a perfect quality cut of extreme precision, but at a high cost of time. The smallest 3 x 5 inch tpad may take over 24 hours to process, followed by finishing operations which, again, need extreme length of time due to the hardness of the material.
The material used for tpad covers can easily shield you from bullets; it will also survive any number of trips in your back pocket. You can unlock your tpad and refill it at any time with a large selection of papers available using standard disposable notepads, or you can use your office spiral binding equipment to create your own custom paper pages.
The cost of manufacturing tpads is very high. We are convinced their quality will blow you away and all leather notebooks, regardless of their embossing patterns, will look as cheap imitations when matched with an amazing beauty and strength of Titanium bound tpads.
For anyone with allergies Titanium offers the only material which doesn’t react with human body.

We conducted a large number of tests for each tpad product, starting with 3D prints and including engineering stress tests for prototypes to determine feasibility of the concept.
10 lbs Sledge Hammer Drop Test from 6 feet
Standard notebook vs Ti cover

Hitting titanium coils with such extreme force will leave a mark: see coils impression in a solid wood below. tcoil survived the hit with a barely noticeable mark.
Coil Binding
Spiral (or coil) binding is used for creating notepads, notebooks, documents, reports, and presentations. Documents bound with a spiral coil can open flat and offer 360 degree rotation for easy note taking.
Coil binding hole patterns. There are several hole pattern used with coil binding. Our final selection of the pitch for each product may be adjusted based on many factors, including the manufacturing tests.
4:1 pitch hole pattern uses 4 holes per inch on the edge of the document.
0.2475" pitch very similar to the 4:1 pitch. This pitch was designed to perfectly center 44 holes on an 11 inch binding edge.
3:1 pitch uses 3 holes per inch on the edge of the document. It is our preferred pitch (at the moment) because of a heavy gauge of our Titanium wire vs. thin standards used in the industry.
2.5:1 pitch coil (0.400 pitch coil) uses 2.5 holes per inch.
2:1 pitch uses 2 holes per inch
3.2:1 pitch (0.3125" pitch) is common for larger books.

campaign.story:
Our Kickstarter is over, but you can still order FLIP BAND here.
The simplest way to stick to your goals
One day, I realized that despite having 3 reminders set on my phone to “do pushups & take vitamins,” I STILL WASN’T DOING IT. Turns out a lot of people have something they wish they did more often but don’t. So I decided to use my 10 years of design + behavior change experience to come up with a solution. Soon afterwards, FLIP BAND was born.
FLIP BAND is a wristband you wear as a reminder to do a goal of your choice, whether that’s exercising, meditating, or just taking your vitamins. The act of wearing the band alone already makes it close to impossible to forget your goal, but here’s the cool part... it’s double-sided, and you only get to flip it to its green ‘feel good’ side after you reach your goal for the day. FLIP BAND seems very simple, but it leverages a wealth of learnings from behavioral psychology and operant conditioning to effectively increase your chances of sticking to your goals in the long-term.
I originally had no intention of turning FLIP BAND into a product but after seeing how effective it was for friends and family I had to share it with other people. So here I am, Kickstarter!
What people are saying:
 What kind of goals can FLIP BAND be used for?
Just about anything really, but here are some popular examples: 
How can something so simple actually work?
The FLIP BAND is more powerful than you think. It takes advantage of several aspects of human psychology to increase your chances of sticking to a goal. FLIP BAND works because:
It forces you to focus: Most people fail because they want to change too many things in their lives at once and as a result never really commit to any single change. Wearing a Flip Band forces you to focus on one change at a time. If you do this and end up forming one new good habit each month, you’ll end up building 12 good habits per year… not bad.
It’s rooted in science: Behavioral science states that every behavior requires three components to occur: ability, motivation, and a trigger. The trigger is the thing that reminds (or triggers) you to DO the behavior. Overtime, our own daily patterns can become triggers (e.g. waking up leads to you brushing your teeth) but in the early stages of building a new habit, we often need some kind of external trigger (e.g. a post-it note) to remind us to actually DO the behavior. That’s exactly what the FLIP BAND is for your goal  – a trigger that’s with you EVERYWHERE you go and on your wrist where you can easily see it.
It’s rooted in MORE science: The simple act of flipping your FLIP BAND after you reach your goal and seeing a bright green checkmark is rooted in the science of positive reinforcement which has been proven to act as a motivator that strengthens a behavior over time (like sticking to your goal) 
It leverages the power of accountability: People who pursue a goal with an accountability buddy (which we recommend) are on average 2x-5× more likely to stick to their goals long term. That’s why your order comes with a minimum of two FLIP BANDS.
It’s tech-free (a.k.a. distraction free): How many times have you grabbed your phone with the intention of doing something specific (e.g. looking something up) but ended up getting distracted by a text message or notification in the process? Apps open you up to distractions simply by being on your phone. FLIP BAND will never do this... but it *will* keep working past two in the afternoon (can you say infinite batteries?)
Rewards:
Stretch goal unlocked: FLIP BAND is now available to everyone in white! 
                                 The easiest way to help is to share the project on facebook or twitter (won't auto-post). The more supporters we get, the more possibilities!
 Details:
FLIP BAND is made of beautiful high-quality materials that are built to last, soft, and comfortable. It's doubly reinforced for durability and finished with high-precision embossed text for a sleek look and feel. Manufacturing is more costly this way but it's well worth it. 
It has a great feeling *snap* when flipped
BEFORE reaching your goal
AFTER reaching your goal
MY STORY
It's been a lifelong goal of mine to create things that help people. I've been a designer for over 10 years, have spent the past 5 years studying the psychology of behavior change, and 3 years co-founding a company called Everest that created what was once one of the most popular goal-setting apps. Earlier this year I also launched The Dept. of Motivation ... as you can see, I've been obsessed with finding ways to help people be their best selves for a long time, and this pursuit has led me to launch dozens of products along the way.
A FREE REWARD FOR ANYONE...
I want to live in a world where people wake up excited every day, regardless of their financial situation.  For this reason I'm choosing to give away a reward for FREE. All you need to do is:
1) Post a link to MyFlipBand.com on Facebook, Twitter, or any social media with the #flipband hashtag 
2) Shoot me an email at MyFlipBand@gmail.com with a screenshot or link to where you shared it
And you'll get: The full PDF of the 'Goal Setting Toolkit' for you to download, print and use to design the life of your dreams. 
I believe if we all helped each other even 1% more, the world would quickly grow to be 10 times better.  With your support, FLIP BAND will reach more people and we can all live in a world where more people pursue their dreams.
NEXT STEPS & TIMELINE
After getting dozens of samples from different manufacturers, I finally found a manufacturer I love and have everything ready to go. It's my goal to get you your Flip Band as soon as possible, and here's my plan to do so: 
February: Submit final designs to manufacturer for first production run, packaging, and delivery to me (expected 3-4 week turnaround) 
Early March: Quality assurance, finalize shipment & fulfillment process
End of March: Begin fulfillment process to you (woohoo!)
Our Kickstarter is over, but you can still order FLIP BAND here.

Risks and challenges
I've worked extremely hard to ready this product for Kickstarter, and it is my goal to get you your FLIP BAND as soon as possible. 

I have 5 years of experience shipping products (10 years of experience designing them), and the only real risk I see is that sometimes things can go awry in the manufacturing and shipping process that can't be planned for (a supplier misses a deadline, a machine breaks down, or a shipment gets lost). I am overseeing every step of the process myself to minimize chances of unexpected delays and ensure that you receive a quality product as soon as possible. 

Trust me, I am just as excited as you are to get you your FLIP BAND and see what you accomplish with it! This is my dream.

campaign.story:
Greetings! I am William Shatner, and I have a confession to make.
I’ve been unemployed over 400 times in my life. I’ve had to reinvent myself over and over to get hired by TV shows, movie producers, and even by Priceline.com when I was 60+ years old.
Source: IMDB
If you or someone you know is over 50 and feels like it’s too late to catch up and re-invent the second half of their lives, TRUST ME…IT’S NOT!
People over 50 have been pretty beat up lately with downsizing, a slumping economy, and so many changes in the way things work. That’s why I wrote this new book Catch Me Up and I need your help to get it to the people who need it most.
In a nutshell, this book is about two things:
1. Achieving great things in your life at any age
2. How to leverage the new technology around us today to do anything you want, at warp speed.
I have another confession. Until just recently I HATED new technology. My “smart” phone made me feel stupid. My grandkids had to show me how to use Facebook. I even refused to have an email account. You know what I found out? Without this know-how, I was becoming irrelevant…and a guy like me can’t afford to be irrelevant. So I did something about it.
I went on a mission to find people who had been laid off, lost careers, had been downsized and replaced by younger people with more tech skills; but who actually fought back and won!
I interviewed some amazing people for this book.
PLAY

 Meet Cliff Brahm who left the rat race at 50, and became his own boss.
PLAY

This is Dave Bateman, who left his legal practice and became a coffee farmer in Hawaii.
PLAY

 This is Julie Cole whose spectacular entrepreneurial spirit has grown stronger in her later years.
 The biggest common denominator among the success stories in the book is that in every case these newly energized folks have discovered new technologies to create their new lives.
This is not just a book of “feel good” stories.
This is real life inspiration along with the vital tools and training needed to accomplish great things at any age!
 This book and the website are labors of love. I really believe it can give hope, skills, and even community to a portion of our population that really needs it right now.
Frankly, lofty goals like this are not that appealing to big publishers. Going the traditional route would've required a number of sacrifices including a change in the overall message. So I've decided to take a page from my own book, so to speak, and use crowdsourcing to fund this project. 
 Through Kickstarter, I can preserve the integrity of this movement and give you, my backers, the chance to be a significant part of my cherished project.  You may be asking yourself…
 Most folks have parents, grandparents, an aunt or an uncle who could use some inspiration and maybe even some community. Getting this book in their hands from a guy like me might give them the inspiration to get up, dust themselves off and try again.
 First of all, thank you for scrolling all the way to the bottom and for believing in my vision for Catch Me Up. To become one of my backers, just click on the big green button at the top of the page, to the right of our video. Kickstarter will ask you for your pledge, which reward you want, and how you want to sign up. Signing up is easy! You can even do it through Facebook.

 We will update you RIGHT HERE on Kickstarter! Once you’re a backer, we will be able to communicate directly and exclusively to our backers and show you all of the work in progress.

Don't Panic!  You can Pre-Order your copy of The Great Debate from our website. 
http://www.castleproductions.co/store.html
Ages: 13+   Number of players: 3-10  Time: ~4 minutes per player
We are a Dallas Designer Group endorsed product.
The Great Debate is a card game designed to get people debating quickly over dozens of interesting subjects in a light and casual manner. It plays best from 5-10 players and each round takes mere minutes to play (but you’ll likely find yourself playing it all evening).
We all debate with our friends, family and co-workers over numerous topics every day, and even play Devil’s Advocate once in a while. We debate issues from the trivial, such as “Is bacon the ultimate ingredient?” to the profound, such as “Does charity breed poverty?” This is why we created The Great Debate. It’s a party game that not only provides a highly interactive way for people to voice their opinions about these subjects in a safe and playful environment, but also uses our unique “Icebreaker” system to help you learn more about the people you’re playing with. Who knows, the person you just met might become your new hiking buddy, skydiving mentor, or scrap booking partner! 
The Great Debate is not just fun, but also educational and enlightening. Since it covers a wide array of topics, people often learn about topics they might not know about. They may hear, or even pose, a different opinion that gives them cause to reflect or laugh. Even those who are initially shy about speaking in groups can quickly overcome their fears since they’re only given 30 seconds to talk on a subject – and they don’t even have to believe what they say. The point is not to be right, but to be more convincing than your opponent and to have fun while doing it. The time limit teaches people how to hone their debate skills by thinking on their feet, and delivering their points in a short, concise fashion. Play our game, and you’ll soon find yourself having an engaging, thought provoking, laughing great time with your friends and family.
Here is a limited print and play version prototype to give you idea of the questions in the game.
80 Unique Debate Cards – hand selected and play tested for fun!
