campaign.story:
Zen Habits: Mastering the Art of Change
This is for anyone who has struggled.
Anyone who has gone through loss, who is struggling with a major life change, who is frustrated.
Anyone who, like me, has struggled to make changes in their lives. I was stuck there 9 years ago, and I'd lost hope. Then I scraped and dug my way out of it, and I am proof that change is possible.
This book will help you make any change:
Exercise
Eating healthy
Getting out of debt
Overcoming procrastination
Losing weight
Dealing with frustrations & stress
Improving relationships
Simplifying & decluttering
Meditating and being mindful
Dealing with major life changes
And much more
This book starts about being about habit change, but it's much more ... it's about how to live, and how to master the process of change. It's about dealing with major life changes, and small frustrating ones too.
In the process of creating a small change in your life, by following the steps in this book ... you'll start to develop core Zen skills I've learned from my studies, to find peace, contentment, and the ability to adjust to situations as they change.
In practicing these skills, you begin to truly understand them. And in understanding these skills, you'll start to overcome your struggles.
This is a volume of condensed learning about the process of change, and the nature of our minds. And a how-to on how to change your habits and overcome procrastination.
My Story
It started with my struggle with change — in 2005, I was an overweight, sedentary, broke, deeply-in-debt, junk-food-eating smoker surrounded by clutter and no time for my wife or kids. I was stuck, desperate, overwhelmed, with no idea how to get out.
But then I learned the principles of change, by doing a ton of research, studying those who were successful at change, and making some small changes. One at a time. Through these experiments, I learned things that help with any change.
Over the next few years, I changed everything ... one step at a time:
Quit smoking
Started running, ran several marathons & a 50-mile ultramarathon
Started eating healthier, eventually became vegan
Lost 60 lbs.
Simplified and got rid of clutter
Got out of debt
Started a successful blog, quit my day job
Overcame procrastination, wrote numerous books
Found time for my health, family, writing, reading
And much more
Since then I've helped tens of thousands of struggling people change their lives through habit change. I've learned what works, and what doesn't, and honed my habit method.
The Heart of Any Problem
Going deeper than the mechanics of habit change, this book will teach you how to get at the heart of any problem you face in life. Any struggle you're facing: procrastination, unhappiness with ourselves, anger with others, stress and worry, dealing with loss or illness.
What is the heart of any struggle? It's attachment to our ideals. Attachment to comfort and the way we'd like things, attachment to how we think people should act, how we should act, how things should go.
We all face this problem, and we can't avoid having ideals. These ideals can be useful, but when we become too tightly attached to them, we create problems for ourselves: frustration, irritation, anger, disappointment, stress, worry.
This stops us from making habit changes, and makes dealing with other people and major changes in our lives much more difficult.
By getting to the heart of your struggles, you will find the way to overcome them.
Change yourself, change the world
When you back this project, it's not just to get a copy of my book. I'd like you to be a part of a movement, and backing this says that you think this is a worthy movement.
What movement? My hope is that this book will help you change your life — to help you change habits, become more focused, procrastinate less, and find peace.
And if you can change yourself, you've changed a small part of the world.
By changing ourselves, we become the example of change for others around us.
We become inspiration for further change, and that spreads into the world.
My deepest wish is for you to use this book and create change in yourself, and everyone around you.
If this happens, we've succeeded.
Testimonials
As I wrote this book, I tested it out on a small group of alpha testers who implemented it and gave me feedback. I called them the Change Labs group, and they were instrumental in shaping this book.
"Leo has distilled a ton of actionable wisdom into the Zen Habits book and I couldn't recommend it enough. Change Labs, a program to alpha test the tools and processes in the book, was one of the most memorable things I've done this year and I can't wait to read it!" 
-Alyson Madrigan
---
"The Change Labs concept has brought fundamental changes to my life. I struggled with severe procrastination in my illustration work which I can say I have overcome during this year. Working both on the fundamentals (underlying fears) both on habits (making 20 min drawing an everyday priority) have lifted me to a different level. I have just finished a 240 page children's story book in a quality and time frame I never dreamed I was able to. This was a great proof for me.
"I also love the simplicity of his concepts. No bullshit, just pure inspiration and actions."
- Cecilia Simonyi
---
"Working with Leo challenged some deeply rooted beliefs about how to lead a fulfilling life. 
"It was like having a eureka moment; a paradigm shift occurred.
"You come out with new ways of thinking and a new arsenal of tools to deal with difficulties."
- Kavi Thancanamootoo
---
"Learning new habits with Leo was the best thing that happened to me in a very long time. Life changer. Forever grateful Leo ..."
- Hanane
Where the Money Will Go
I'm asking for $44,700, which will pay for:
An editor ($1,200)
Book designer ($5,000)
Printing ($7,000)
Shipping ($3,500)
Kickstarter/Amazon payments fee ($4,000)
Publishing project manager ($5,000)
Website, ebook, video production ($6,000)
International shipping additional cost $2,000
Leo's salary $7,000
Taxes: $4,000
Total: $44,700
Note: the above positions are already filled.
In addition, there might be a few possible additional printing costs and unexpected costs, so I'd love a little padding on our budget.
(Edited: I added international shipping costs, a small salary for myself, and other production costs that weren't initially included, and removed the cost of an event, which I'll pay for from my salary.)
Stretch funding goal
I'd love it if we could go over the $45,000 minimum goal. If you guys can help me get to a higher funding figure, this will allow me to:
Print a 2nd, less-limited edition to sell on Amazon and elsewhere
Get paid (a little more) for some of my own time
See that this is a viable model for publishing future books
Show the world that this topic is important
So don't stop helping this project if we hit the minimum!
BONUS: If we get to higher than the goal, I promise to start making videos to send out to all backers — videos about my writing routine, my workouts, how I cook my healthy meals, parenting, etc. And one of my beautiful wife and kids. I'll make one new video for every $15K over the $45K goal. Update: I've recorded some bonus videos already, more to come!
Kickstarter-exclusive Bonuses
I'm offering a number of bonuses for different reward levels here on Kickstarter, not available anywhere else:
First, the limited-edition digital and print versions of this book are not going to be sold anywhere else for at least 6 months, until I do a 2nd edition.
Exclusive webinar with Lift: I'm going to hold a limited webinar (200-person limit) with the CEO of the Lift habit app, on creating habits. This will be held in December 2014.
Bonus guides: I'm creating special guides for the reward levels from the Print Edition level and higher. They'll be PDF guides to 1) procrastination & effectiveness; and 2) mindfulness. These won't be available anywhere else. Read more.
Early bird feedback: For the $98+ reward level, I'm going to give you first access to the web version of the book in December (you'll still get 3 copies of the print edition when it's ready), before anyone else. This will give you a chance to give me feedback that could change the book before it's printed.
10-person webinars: For the $300+ reward level, I'm going to hold a webinars for 10 people at a time, where all 10 people in the webinar can ask me questions. They'll last about an hour, and I'll schedule them in December & January, so you can pick whatever date/time works best for your schedule. These webinars are more intimate than the webinar above.
3-month coaching & private event: At the $1,500 level, I'm taking on 15 people in a small-group coaching program that will last from January through March, and end in a private event in San Francisco. The coaching will be on habits and dealing with life changes and other struggles — basically, what I cover in the book — and you can ask me questions and work with the other people in the program, getting accountability and support. The event will be with me, and will last an entire weekend in April, and will include seminars and group activities and guest speakers and tea and food and maybe some meditation. It'll be fun! You'll need to pay your own way to get there, and your own accommodations. Read more about the coaching program & event.
Speak at your event: At the top level, I'll give a talk at your conference or private event. I almost never give talks, so this is a pretty exclusive bonus. I'll speak for up to an hour, on a topic we agree upon, and can be available for Q&A after or whatever else you like (within reason). You'll also have to pay for my airfare, on top of the $10,000.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I'm confident this book will be printed, but there are a few risks and challenges to note:

1. Possible delays from the printer — though I've been published by a traditional publisher and have self-published numerous ebooks, I've never printed a book on my own before. But I'm using a highly-recommended professional printer, so I'm confident things will go well.

2. Shipping delays — We'll be using a fulfillment company to ship the books out once printed, and it's possible this will take a little longer than I'd like, so we'll all have to breathe if there are any delays.

3. Technical glitches — I'll be publishing this book on the web and in a few digital editions (Kindle, epub for the iPad, and PDF), so there is always the possibility of technical glitches that delay things. But I've done these before, and they're not that difficult.

All of this is doable, and I don't anticipate major problems.

See the estimated timeline here: http://zenhabitsbook.com/timeline/

campaign.story:
Missed the campaign? Visit BlankForces.com
For the uninitiated, E.D.C. stands for Every Day Carry and is a popular topic of discussion regarding the need to always be prepared no matter the circumstances. EDC Ink™ is a line of high quality, rugged, and durable pens for your keychain or bag, designed so you will never be without one of the most used items in everyday life.
THE DESIGN
As a designer and someone that loves to travel I often find myself in need of a pen for quickly sketching an idea, making a list, or filling out the inevitable form.
This pen hides on your keychain and will travel with you everywhere allowing you to forget about it. It’s the perfect everyday companion...you will never have to ask to borrow a pen again!
I'm a minimalist when it comes to what I carry and don't like to carry extra stuff or have to remember extra things. With this need in mind I started to look for a small/cool pen that I could carry every day without having to think about it and without it being too big and bothersome.
After a lot of searching I couldn't find anything that met my needs so I decided to create my own compact pen which attached to my keyring.
MY DESIGN REQUIREMENTS:
1. It needed to be a very compact, go every-where size which fit on my keyring.
2. It needed to use standard, easy-to-find refills.
3. It needed to be easy to replace the ink without any special tools.
4. It needed to be rugged, durable, and reflect my appreciation for design and quality.
These pens are made from the classic combination of 304 stainless steel and brass; the metals helped define the design and provided the inspiration for the pure, clean aesthetic. Every part is functional and simplified to the extreme. These pens utilize the raw metal’s natural characteristics and native colors to produce the detail accents of the tip and end screw.
These precision machined parts fit together so perfectly that the parting line between the pen barrel and cap virtually disappear, resulting in an object that hides its identity until it’s used.
Despite their small size, the precise fit and weight of the raw metals make them feel substantial, solid, and nice to handle.
LASER ENGRAVING
I'm very excited to offer these pens in three engraved treatments that really elevate the pen to a piece of functional art which you get to enjoy and carry with you every day.
PLAY

While I love the purity of this design on its own, I often have to measure things for my work, so I added both metric and imperial measurement scales on the PRO version. I have found this added function to be incredibly useful and right there where you need it.
ABOUT THE ENGRAVING - This process uses a high powered FIBER laser to remove metal, so the engraving is actually recessed into the surface of the metal resulting in a permanent mark that also adds texture to the surface of the pens and provides more grip to hold the pen when writing.
LASER ENGRAVING OPTIONS
1. NAKED - No Engraving - This is a completly naked pen; it is super-clean and elegant.

2. PRO - The Measuring Scale - With both standard and metric on the same pen. An incredibly useful combination, a pen and a ruler in one.

3. ICON - The cool linear box pattern is seamlessly engraved all the way around the entire pen, including the cap. You can't even tell where the cap ends and the pen barrel begins.

4. LACE - A beautiful and elegant pattern, seamlessly engraved all the way around the entire pen, including the cap. You can't even tell where the cap ends and the pen barrel begins.
5. JOIN, or DIE - I'm really excited to add our first Backer selected pattern. It was selected from a group of four designs with a landslide victory of 46% of the vote. 
For those that aren't familiar with the "Join, or Die" graphic, it is an historic image created by Benjamin Franklin around 1754 and represents the quest for strength and freedom through solidarity. Each part of the snake represents one of the first colonies of the United States. Learn more here: Wikipedia.org/wiki/Join,_or_Die
"SPECIAL ARTIST EDITION" ENGRAVINGS
I am collaborating with some very talented artists to offer some amazing and original "Special Artist Edition" engraving patterns. Please note that these engraving patterns each have their own separate pricing and reward tiers.
I’m a huge fan of Dan Hillier’s incredibly detailed drawings, collages and paintings. His mind blowing pieces are full of wonder and classic details. Based in England, Dan’s work unites a unique range of spiritual and historical elements. His part human, part animal subjects, transports us to fascinating new worlds where the 1800's and fantasy collide. See more of Dan’s beautiful work at www.DanHillier.com
  The HILLIER : SAPLING is currently only available in the X1 size. 
I'm very honored and excited to have the opportunity to collaborate with illustrator and street muralist, Liqen. Originally from Spain, he has traveled the world painting his thought provoking murals. Through his imaginative use of hybrid creatures that appear to have evolved from prehistoric times, he brings awareness to modern time issues and moral dilemmas. His work takes you on a never imagined visual journey that teases different levels of the mind.  
Click HERE to see a cool video of Liqen in action.
Learn more about him: www.Liqen.org/
  LIQEN : CABEZAS design is available in both X1 and X2 sizes.
Dan Funderburgh is a Brooklyn-based illustrator, artist, and wallpaper designer whose pieces are beautiful and incredibly unique. With his often playful use of everyday objects he creates surprising and delightful works of art that are reminiscent of historical patterns but with a modern spin. 
I have been a longtime admirer of Dan’s unique work and think we are incredibly lucky to have him involved with the project! See more of his work: www.DanFunderburgh.com
THE TWO SIZES
EDC Ink is available in two sizes: X1 and the slightly longer X2. All pens will come with the small stainless steel split ring already attached to the pen's cap making it easy to put it on any keyring.
X1 - Specifications:
Length: 3.2" (81mm)
Diameter: 0.31" (7.9mm)
Weight: 0.83 oz. (23.6 grams)
Materials: 304 Stainless Steel Body. Brass Tip, and Brass End Screw.
This is the smallest pen and the one I carry (I have medium sized hands). It virtually disappears on your key ring. While the X1 is a bit small for a lengthy writing or sketching session, it is perfect for capturing an idea or jotting down items on your to-do list.
X2 - Specifications:
Length: 4" (101mm)
Diameter: 0.31" (7.9mm) 
Weight: 1.1 oz. (31.4 grams)
Materials: 304 Stainless Steel Body. Brass Tip, and Brass End Screw.

X2 would be better for people with large hands, people that plan to do more writing, or someone that doesn't mind carrying a slightly longer pen.
THE AWESOME INK REFILL
The EDC Ink pens are designed around the standard D1 refill which is readily available. This compact refill is typically used in multi-selector pens and is available in most stores that sell ink refills.
I will be supplying these pens with my favorite refill to sketch with, the well-known but typically hard-to-find Pilot HI-TEC-C Slims. This refill is ultra precise, smooth, and fast drying… which is especially important for us lefties.

If you would like extra Pilot HI-TEC-C Slims (blue or black color ink) refills, please add $5 per refill to your pledge. 
NOTE: The D1 size refill is also available in the popular and well respected Fisher Space Pen refill. This special pressurized version is known by many for its ability to write under water, upside down, or in outer space. You can easily order this refill through the Fisher Space Pen website here. I won't be supplying this refill.
STRETCH GOALS
First STRETCH GOAL reached! $20,000 unlocked the backer selected JOIN, or DIE graphic option.
Second STRETCH GOAL of $60,000 reached!
With backers support, we have now surpassed the $60,000 stretch goal that allows us to offer black as well as blue ink. Now backers have their choice of either blue or black ink for their pens and/or any additional refills. 
TITANIUM KEYRINGS
I researched and tested a lot of keyring options from wire to small carabiners and settled on the ultra-lightweight and virtually indestructible GRADE 5 Titanium Keyrings. These beautiful split rings are 1.2" in diameter (30mm dia.).

Add an awesome GRADE 5 Titanium Keyring for an additional pledge of $4.
THE PERFECT GIFT
For the guy or girl who has everything, this is the perfect high-quality, functional gift that they can always have with them while reminding them of you. Who doesn't need a pen? 
While I would love to be able to ship these pens by Christmas, we won't have enough time. So I've created a beautiful holiday gift card that we can send out before Christmas. The card shows the pen actual size (closed on the cover of the card and open when the card is opened) with the desired laser engraving pattern. A blank envelope will also be provided for the card. 
Following is what the holiday gift card will look like.

If you would like a gift card, please add $6 to your pledge to cover the cost of the card and shipping.
PACKAGING
In order for me to keep costs down, I will be shipping these pens with only basic packaging. They are designed to live on your keychain, so I also would prefer to not contribute to the landfill. 
GIFT PACKAGING - If this is intended as a gift, I can provide a simple pen box for an additional $5 pledge.
REPLACING THE INK REFILL
There are two ways to replace the ink refill. The simplest is to grab the tip of the ink refill and pull it from the body. The other is to use a dime or flat head screwdriver in the slot in the end screw which unscrews to reveal the refill. 
PROJECT TIMELINE
I am happy to say that we will be making these pens here in Los Angeles, CA. The following timeline is based on the production of 500 pens, and I think it is realistic target even with the slowdown during the holidays. 
KICKSTARTER PRICING
Fortunately, by using Kickstarter we are cutting out the middleman (the retailer) and I am able to offer these pens at a significantly lower price than the future retail priceing. Kickstarter does take 5%, and the credit card processing is another 3-5% for a total of 8-10%.
A VERY BIG THANK YOU!
I'm really excited about this project and if you have read this far I'm glad you are finding it interesting. I have a lot more ideas, and with your support we can make this project, and hopefully many others, possible.

I would love for everyone to always be ready to capture their ideas… you never know when it will be the one!

campaign.story:
PLAY

Have you looked around lately?? Well I have. Spinach, popcorn and poppy seeds are defacing nearly every corner of humanity.
SHIT-IN-M'TEETH is a credit card-sized solution to help yourself, or anyone else in your life, who needs a dental intervention. Back SHIT-IN-M'TEETH for only $5 and you get both the Reflection Technology and set of Excavation Tools so you can take back your dignity. 
Your support is needed for tooling, materials, production and packaging. Each day SHIT-IN-M'TEETH goes unproduced, dates end tragically, presentations implode, and the shame spiral spins faster.  I completed the design, but funding is now my last hurdle to help bring this radical innovation to the filthy masses.  
*************************************************************************************************
FACT:  Did you know that 90% of people WANT to be told by a friend or colleague if they have food stuck in their teeth, but only 20% report that they ACTUALLY DO tell a friend or colleague if they have food in their teeth. How awkward is that?
                                 - source: National online study, conducted July, 2014
*************************************************************************************************
SHIT-IN-M’TEETH was born out of shame. One day, two years ago after teaching a morning class to sixty undergraduates, I realized my breakfast was likely the key take-away from the lecture (a particularly aggressive blueberry). I conducted a national online survey on people’s experiences with getting food stuck in their teeth and what I learned was truly shocking…
-- 65% of people have had an "extremely embarrassing"  or "traumatic" experience resulting from unknowingly having had food stuck in their teeth
-- 70% of people have a friend or family member who frequently gets food stuck in their teeth
Moreover, I learned that people use random, reflective objects to check their teeth throughout the day, such as shiny office staplers and reflective picture frames on their desk… Which led me to ask, REALLY?!
TOP 10 OFFENDERS: These foods more than any other plague civilization.
#1 Spinach
#2 Ribs
#3 Popcorn
#4 Steak
#5 Poppy seeds
#6 Spices
#7 Corn on the cob
#8 Broccoli
#9 Seeds from berries
#10 Bread
THE INNOVATION
I believe in options, so I designed these Excavation Tools shown below.
Close up: SHIT-IN-M’TEETH Excavation Tools
A formidable arsenal at your finger tips: a Pick Axe, Jackhammer, Battle Axe, Sword and Missile. And just in case you missed it, there are traditional toothpicks at the bottom if you don’t like progress. It shows six tooth picks here, but my hope is to get eight or ten designed into the final product.
What you see above is a laser-cut piece of black acrylic. The final product will be die-stamped plastic, looking almost identical, and I am in the process of evaluating vendors and the final production process. From the start I have been advised by an engineer with deep experience in die-stamping and I know the production method will work.
The backside of the mirror will provide vital instructions for how to operate SHIT-IN-M’TEETH. It’s as easy as 1-2-3.
Back of SHIT-IN-M'TEETH Mirror
Here are other close-ups of some of the Excavation Tools:
Missile
Battle Axe
Jackhammer
Like you, I love going on journeys with Kickstarter creators, so I promise to send at least two “making of” videos along the way to bring you into the action. I can assure you that I have got my hands on all the key printing, stamping/production and fulfillment/shipping issues. I’m serious and this will get done. This is what will arrive at your door if you back my Kickstarter:
What you get
So, please do me and your dignity a favor – back my Kickstarter. There are some great reward options above ($5, $25, and $50+), particularly if you are throwing a big BBQ, family reunion, or event soon. Also, because dental damnation certainly isn’t limited to the U.S., I will ship anywhere in the world. Yes, anywhere!
Finally, know that there are other dental-attack tool sets in the works if we can reach the funding goal. Think Sci-Fi Lover, Medieval-Justice, and Grill-Meister. If we can build steam, I’d love to crowdsource your ideas on new arsenals to retake the dental homeland. Thank you.
Coverage of SHIT-IN-M'TEETH:
Credits:
      A HUGE thank you to gifted Emerson College film student Brian Roth for co-producing the "Hardly Revolutionary" video and Christine Beggs for co-producing my main video.
An EQUALLY HUGE thank you to the New Hampshire Gentlemen of the University of New Hampshire for arranging the "SHIT-IN-M'TEETH!" jingle, which I understand has been submitted for a Grammy.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Number one risk? Doing nothing. Carrying on like we don't have a global problem. Sure, you may choose to doubt climate change, but no one in your meeting doubts you had steak for lunch. 

Number two risk? A key issue to manage is mailing and shipping costs. My cost model makes very conservative (i.e., high) assumptions about mailing costs. In my mind, your love life or professional existence may be hanging in the balance here, so I don’t want any setbacks on the shipping front. Also, I only plan to produce only 500-600 units of SHIT-IN-M’TEETH so fulfillment should be manageable. 

Number three risk? Choking hazard. Seriously. SHIT-IN-M’TEETH isn’t for children. These are adventure weapons for “big kids”, and meant to be in one’s wallet or purse, enabling a high state of readiness. SHIT-IN-M’TEETH is a tool not a toy. The SHIT-IN-M’TEETH packaging will have an appropriate warning label. 

Number four risk? The spinach industry. By my calculations, 26% 
of spinach goes uneaten each year due to “failed consumption” or what industry executives refer to as “tooth sticking”. Widespread adoption of SHIT-IN-M’TEETH could solve this problem and anger powerful industry executives.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The Kickstarter Campaign has just concluded but if you still wish to pledge you can head to RoyaltyFreeDoc.com/Kickstarter 
Thank you to all our backers we wouldn't be able to make this documentary without you!
[We have a Closed Captions enabled version of the above video on YouTube here.]
Composer Kevin MacLeod of Incompetech.com has helped thousands of artists across the world by releasing his music royalty free. Anyone can use his music - including you! FOR FREE! His music has ended up in countless films, shows, video games, apps, online videos, and pretty much anywhere you can think of. Ever watch a YouTube video? Then you've probably heard his music. If you’ve ever used Kevin’s music and were waiting for a way to give back, now is the time. Just a small pledge from you can help us tell his story and encourage others to follow in his footsteps. Also by pledging, you'll get awesome rewards like digital downloads of the finished film, DVDs, posters, autographed sheet music, and more.
In 1996, during the early days of the web, Kevin MacLeod, a software programmer with an interest in composing, founded a personal webpage Incompetech.com (named so after his fascination with incompetence and technology). After music he created for a composing job was rejected, he put the music on his website for free hoping that someone out there would find a use for it. We will tell the story of how in 18 years since Incompetech’s humble beginnings, it has grown from a few songs to thousands that have been heard by millions of people worldwide.
Throughout college and beyond, we, the producers, used Kevin’s music without realizing who Kevin was, or how big he had become. Curious, we began to research him, wondering how someone whose music was so widespread could be so unknown? The more we learned, the more questions we had: What do other composers think of his business model? What is the significance of Incompetech post the YouTube copyright crisis and SOPA/PIPA (Stop Online Piracy Act/Protect Internet Protocol Act), where copyright laws are choking the Internet’s creative potential?
We will also cover various people who have used Kevin’s music like: Machinima, Team Coco, Facing Fear (Oscar Nominated Short), PowerPark (An amusement park in Finland), the Nostalgia Chick, Film Brain, MikeJ, Phelous, Hugo, BuzzFeed, College Humor, Monty Python, CaptainSparklez, The Fine Bros, IGN, The Syndicate Project, Tobuscus, JeromeASF, Rooster Teeth, Sky Does MInecraft, Shane Dawson, Michelle Phan, FPS Russia, Enchufe.TV, KSIOlajidebt, SeaNanners, Philip DeFranco (SxePhil), Yogscast, Slamacow, Bad Teeth, CGP Grey, Element Animation, Jack Vale, SethBling, Mediocre Films, Mondo Media, TomSka, OfficialNerdCubed, SSundee, DeadloxMC, Team Crafted, Troye Sivan, ExplodingTNT, Laci Green, EricArchive, GK Films, The Stanley Parable, Kerbal Space Program, Evan Glodell (Bellflower), Magnetic Billiards, Card Hero, Chronicles of a Dark Lord, Your Doodles are Bugged!, Galactic Conflict RTS, Battlehorn (game), Shadow of the Game, Ball: Infinite Challenge, Dream Flight (game), coLAR Mix, The Blockheads (game), Sneak Mouse (game), Putt The Planets, and many many more
Our Official Poster
We can't make this film without you! The funding for this campaign is essential in enabling us to obtain the equipment and materials needed to tell this story the way it deserves. Of course, our goal is the bare minimum we need to proceed. With our current goal we would be forced to do remote interviews with many of our interview subjects, relying on whatever equipment and expertise they could find. campaign.story:
Love Your Face is a fresh and natural skincare line developed for women who want a powerful skin-rejuvenating solution without powerful (and harmful) chemicals.
What makes Love Your Face unique?
Love Your Face is...
#1 100% NATURAL:
Love Your Face products are made from all-natural ingredients and completely free from commonly used chemicals like parabens, mineral oil, phthalates, sodium lauryl sulfate, triclosan, and synthetic fragrances.

You shouldn't have to choose between being beautiful or healthy. With Love Your Face, you can be both.
#2 OUR SPECIAL INGREDIENT – AN ANCIENT HEALING HERB: 
While researching ingredients for our formula, we discovered a forgotten, ancient herb call Plantain (not the banana-like plant, though!), so powerful, Native Americans referred to it as “life medicine.”
Used by cultures around the world for centuries, this herb not only works as an anti-inflammatory, it's an all-natural analgesic and antioxidant that has also been found to enhance the effectiveness of SPF in sunscreens.
Love Your Face is the very FIRST skincare line that uses this herb in an entire line of natural products. Scroll down to the "Our Special Ingredient" section to learn more about this amazing plant.
#3 MINIMALIST:
Less is more. You don't need bottles of half-used, chemical-based skincare products piling up in your bathroom cabinet – you need something that you'll use and something that works.

Love Your Face puts an end to counter clutter with a simple five-product line of essential skincare products. Plus, the bold, and beautiful containers are so sleek, you won't want to hide them.
#4 FEARLESS:
Love Your Face is a social enterprise with a mission that goes beyond simply creating high-quality, all-natural skincare. Every year, we'll give a percentage of our profits back to the community through our FEARLESS FUND to help other women who want to change their lives and the lives of others through entrepreneurial and community-based projects. 
#5 ENVIRONMENTALLY CONSCIOUS:
100% of the ingredients we source are natural, so we think it's extremely important to take care of the planet we all live on. All of our packaging – from our glass bottles to our packing material – is eco-friendly, reusable, or fully recyclable.
By becoming a backer of this project, you will help us launch this movement, and in exchange, you will receive Love Your Face products (and some great bonuses) at a highly discounted price.
Sample-Size Kits vs. Full-Size Kits
Sample-size kits contain our cleanser, scrub, mask and lotion in 1oz glass jars. Full-size kits contain 4oz glass jars of our mask, scrub, and lotion and 8oz glass bottles of our cleanser and spray.
Fearless Weekend
If there's a gap between where you are in life right now and where you want to be, the Fearless Weekend is for you. You'll join dozens of other fearless women for a powerful weekend of fun and growth in the heart of trendy Nashville, TN.

For two days, from August 29 - 30, 2015, we'll help you find the clarity, confidence and courage to lead the life you've always wanted to live. You'll discover how to boldly unleash your gifts onto the world while you make life-long friendships with other passionate women.

(Sorry guys, this is for women only!)
Spa & Adventure Day
The day after the Fearless Weekend is YOUR day. We're taking up to six women for a full day of adventure and rejuvenation.

We'll start the day with breakfast at one of Nashville's most popular restaurants. Afterward, we'll take you just outside Nashville for a team building, zip line tour through the beautiful landscape of Tennessee. You'll be served a gourmet, all vegetarian lunch and, in the afternoon, we'll head to the spa for two relaxing treatments. For dinner, we'll take you to another Nashville hot-spot for incredible food and great company.

It'll be a day you'll never forget, not only because of the experiences you'll have, but because of the life-long friendships that will be created. (Note: This event will take place the day after the Fearless Weekend.)
1-on-1 Business Coaching
Do you run your own business or have an idea for a new business? Through 1-on-1 business coaching, Laurel can help you ignite your business.

You'll learn how to bring in more clients, make more money, and have more free time, all with more ease, so you'll effortlessly be able to share your passion and talent with the world. The coaching package above includes three one-hour private phone sessions with Laurel. (Visit laurelstaples.com for more information.)
Design Our Next Product
This is your opportunity to be part of skincare history!
What's the next Love Your Face product going to be? What essential oils should we use? What name should we give it? It's up to you! 
In the Design-Our-Next-Product package, you will work directly with us to design our next limited edition product. Plus, you'll be given full credit on the website and the product label.
HOLIDAY GIFT CARDS
Want to give Love Your Face as a gift to your friends and family this holiday season? We can help!

Request one of our fun Holiday “IOU” Cards to give as a gift this season. We'll mail them out to you between December 15-December 22. Your friend or family member will get her rewards shipped directly in March 2015.
We don't think it's necessary to clutter your bathroom cabinets with dozens of products...most of which you don't even use.
“Less is more” when it comes to skincare. You only need a few, high-quality products to uncover your most radiant and flawless skin.
The Love Your Face skincare line consists of just five simple (and essential) facial skincare products:
[MAKE TODAY COUNT] CLEANSER - 8oz (Aloe + Plantain)
[KEEP TAKING CHANCES] SCRUB - 4oz (Aloe + Plantain)
[BREAK THE RULES] MASK - 4oz (Aloe + Plantain)
[MAKE IT HAPPEN] LOTION - 4oz (Aloe + Hyaluronic Acid)
[FIND YOUR VOICE] SPRAY - 8oz (Aloe + Rose)
THE FULL COLLECTION: Includes the entire 5-piece collection listed above plus a reusable cotton pouch. Everything is beautifully packaged in a kraft gift box.
THE ESSENTIAL COLLECTION: Includes the full-size cleanser, scrub and lotion plus a reusable cotton pouch. 
SAMPLE SIZE KIT: Includes the cleanser, scrub, mask and lotion, each in 1oz glass jars packaged in a small kraft gift box.
All our products are 100% natural and completely free of harmful parabens, mineral oil, phthalates, sodium lauryl sulfate, triclosan, and synthetic fragrances.
WHAT'S IN A NAME?
Each of the Love Your Face products is named with a piece of advice we'd give our younger selves. Everyday, they're a daily reminder of what it takes to live life fearlessly.
Through extensive research and help from horticulturist Ashlyn Morgan, we discovered an ancient herb that's been used for thousands of years to sooth and heal skin.
Yet, this amazing plant has been all but lost to our culture over the last several decades...until now.
This ancient healing herb is Plantago Major. It's more commonly known as “Plantain” (although it's different than the banana-like plant with the same name).
When we traced this plant back through history, what we found was incredible...
Love Your Face is the VERY FIRST skincare company to use plantain for its entire line of products. And we will source our plantain locally from female farmer & horticulturalist, Ashlyn Morgan, who will grow it exclusively for us in a special, apothecary garden on her 50-acre organic farm in East Tennessee (starting in Spring 2015).
Plantain is great for your skin because it is...
Our broader mission at Love Your Face is to create a company that helps and empowers other women. Creating a skincare line that allows you feel beautiful and confident about the way you look is one way we do that. Another way is through the FEARLESS FUND.
The FEARLESS FUND provides scholarships and training for women who want to open businesses or start community projects that positively affect the community. Once a year, we'll run a contest and award financial support to women who have great ideas and want to turn those ideas into reality. (Note: Kickstarter funds will not go towards FF scholarships.)
We believe that women who follow their dreams are unstoppable. And we want to be a part of the ripple effect of positive change that spreads throughout the world when we start taking action to create better lives for ourselves and others.
We've made small, test market batches of Love Your Face products, but the funds raised via Kickstarter will help us to fully develop and package Love Your Face, so it's ready for release to the public.
The moment this campaign ends, we'll ship Holiday Gift Cards so backers will have them in time to give as gifts to friends and family. We'll finalize our formulation and order the materials needed to start bulk production—ingredients, bottles, packaging, and labels. Manufacturing will start in January 2015 and we'll start taking orders at LYFace.com. Rewards to all backers will be shipped by March 2015.

Five years ago, I got home from work one evening, walked straight into my bathroom and dumped all of my makeup and skincare into the trashcan. I was done with being a victim of the beauty industry.
Earlier that day, I'd discovered that every single one of my regular beauty products—the lotions, cleansers, shampoos, lip balms, and makeup brands I'd used and trusted for more than a decade— contained carcinogens.
How could a company release something known to cause cancer?
I researched the topic further and learned the majority of skincare products on the market contain this type of thing – harsh chemicals and synthetics like parabens, phthalates, tricoloson, sodium laureth sulfate and more. They are skin irritants, endocrine disruptors, and carcinogens.
CHECK OUT WHAT I DISCOVERED...
BreastCancerFund.org: “In the U.S., major loopholes in federal law allow the cosmetics industry to put thousands of synthetic chemicals into personal care products, even if those chemicals are linked to cancer, infertility or birth defects.” 
NaturalNews.com: “Common, brand-name skin care products often contain multiple chemical contaminants known to cause cancer, liver disorders and neurological disorders.” – 
HuffingtonPost.com: “Parabens possess estrogen-mimicking properties that are associated with increased risk of breast cancer. These chemicals are absorbed through the skin and have been identified in biopsy samples from breast tumors. They can be found in makeup, body washes, deodorants, shampoos and facial cleansers.” – 
Environmental Working Group: "One of every five adults is potentially exposed every day to all of the top seven carcinogenic impurities common to personal care product ingredients."  
Livestrong.com: “Methylparaben is used as a fragrance and as a preservative ingredient in skin care products, according to the Skin Deep Cosmetic Database. It is toxic to non-reproductive organs in the human body and may cause cancer, skin irritation, neurotoxicity and may disrupt endocrine function.”  
Being Beautiful Shouldn't Kill You
The majority of skincare products on the market should come with an overt Surgeon General's warning on the front like cigarettes.
But they don't. And they probably never will.
So it's up to each of us to learn the risks involved with using these products and find a better solution for ourselves.
Love Your Face is that solution.
After throwing away my entire beauty regimen, I made it my mission to find products that would work in harmony with my body and not against it. You shouldn't have to risk your health to look and feel beautiful.
When Laurel Met Kate
When I met Kate years later, I discovered that as an aesthetician, she'd been on the same quest to find natural products for herself and her clients. We immediately bonded over our shared passion.
While Kate and I were having coffee one day, the idea for Love Your Face was born. Instead of continuing to search high and low for natural products that met our high standards, we decided to create our own.
So that's exactly what we did. But it didn't stop at a skincare line...
From the moment we came up with the idea for Love Your Face, we wanted our mission to be more than just healthy beauty products. We wanted to start a movement of fearlessness.
Our goal is to help you push fear aside, feel fully confident about yourself, and follow your dreams. That's why we named the company “Love Your Face”, designed packaging with bold & inspiring statements, and launched the FEARLESS FUND. Every bit of Love Your Face has been designed with the fearless woman in mind.
LAUREL STAPLES – COFOUNDER + VISIONARY + CHOCOHOLIC
Laurel Staples is an engineer-turned-entrepreneur. Seven years ago, she quit her corporate mechanical engineering job to launch and develop a series of retail clothing stores specializing in eco-friendly fashion. Today, she is a respected business coach and advisor who specializes in helping business owners across the country increase both freedom and flexibility in their lives without sacrificing profits. Learn more at her website LaurelStaples.com.

campaign.story:
We love Gmail for all it does to make email friendly and more human. But Google hasn’t built an app for Gmail on the desktop like it has on iOS and Android.
Apps like Outlook and Mail wipe away all the unique power of Gmail, leaving many of us to do on the desktop what we’d never want to do on our phones - use it in the browser, buried in the chaos of web browsing.
We’d dreamed of turning Gmail into a powerful, fluid email client that not only makes Gmail easier to use, but goes way beyond and makes a beautiful statement about what email itself could be like.
After 18 months, it’s now almost here. We just need your help to launch.
In building a humanized email client, we wanted to acknowledge basic truths -- like that many of us have more than one Gmail account (personal, school, work, etc). We wanted you to avoid having to sign in over and over every time you close your browser or restart your computer, and we wanted it to work all the time, flawlessly.
Google has struggled to make this work well at all in the browser, where you frequently get signed out at random and generally have a poor experience. We spent months developing and refining a new technology that allows it to "just work" work all the time, without sign-ins or typing or any extra effort on your part. 
USE YOUR EMAIL WITHOUT BEING BURIED BY IT
A huge piece of what we wanted to do with Gmail for Mac was to radically simplify the effort and "cognitive burden" of using your email. It's something we do all day long, all the time, and it should be as easy as breathing. 
We've made radical new ways - entirely unique to our client - for filtering out the noise of email alerts and unread counts that come at you all day long. We've also honed the user experience so that nearly everything you do constantly can be reached in a single click or gesture (navigating your email, writing a new message, opening your inbox, etc). This is the kind of iOS-like focus & simplicity that has liberated us all on mobile. We wanted to do that for email on the desktop. 
AND...
SIMPLE. POWERFUL. BEAUTIFUL.
The difference between using Gmail in the browser and Gmail in our streamlined and powerful app is enormous, and ultimately one we feel will make your email life easier and more friendly. 
More Details
ABOUT US
The guys behind Zive are Eric Shashoua and Ryan Shetley, but we've been joined by an amazing team of designers and developers who share the same idealistic dream of beautiful, simple, and obsessively designed software. We believed we could make a real difference in some of the tools people use most often by making them beautiful, seamless, and effortless on a level that’s encountered too seldomly outside of Apple. We wanted to build a company where the work itself mattered more to us than the bottom line or any traditional goal of business. And ... we wanted it to be human. 
Our team brings to Zive 10+ years of experience designing and developing software and consumer electronics, as well as developing for iOS and the Mac. As the former CEO / Co-Founder of Zeo, Inc., Eric raised $14M in venture funding and had a chance to work with the leaders of Bose and iRobot in learning how to design products that are truly focused on the user. Zeo’s products have been marketed and sold throughout the US and Europe, and have led to being called out to Cupertino in connection with being featured in Apple Stores. Ryan brings to our bold and scrappy team a novel approach to technology, where engineering effort is focused intensely on the user experience rather than the usual product development approach. The rest of our team consists of awesome and intensely passionate designers, a couple artists, and folks who've spent years developing for and falling madly in love with the Mac.  
Disclaimer: Though we love Gmail and we love the Mac, Zive is not affiliated in any way with either Google nor Apple and is an independent third party. Gmail for Mac, by Zive, is a product made entirely by Zive, Inc. and no other company. 
We need your help! Where the funds go:
We already have a polished alpha, but we've started this Kickstarter to get to launch. What that means:
Beta testing phase before launch
OS X 10.10 Yosemite upgrade completion
Possible Inbox by Google integration
Community to help us test, give feedback, and ... well, we just think you guys would be awesome even if you do none of that. 
Marketing funding to help get the word out at launch
So, we're after supporters, a few enthusiastic folks to help us beta test, and launch funding to help kick off the product launch. Please join us and become a part of our bold dream to elevate Gmail to a whole new level!
For your support of us, we've lined up what we think would be really great rewards for anyone who joins on -- starting with a copy of the full version of Gmail for Mac! Take a look at our rewards right on this page!
And thank you for supporting Gmail for Mac, by Zive!

While most kickstarters launch with a concept or prototype, we feel that most of the risk in our project has already been mitigated by having moved far beyond that stage to an alpha version of Gmail for Mac, by Zive.

While this is always a possibility, we don't expect this to play a significant role given the stage we're at. Experience: We've done this before successfully a few times over, and our team has extensive experience designing, building, and selling software through Apple's app and retail stores. 

This is the only project we are running, and has the undivided attention of our team.

Slip your ring on and off as you desire!
- For Men's & Women's rings with a thickness of up to 13mm!

- Perfect for the kitchen, bathroom, gym, and more!

- Choose from 4 initial color options (Black, White, Silver, & Gold) or get them all!

Follow & Share our project!
Were on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.
The goal of our KickStarter campaign is to raise the funds needed to get the mold for the Blingnet manufactured, a batch of Black, White, Silver, and Gold Blingnets produced, and the ability to fulfill shipment orders. We also have hopes to reach a stretch goal and offer several additional color options. 
Please make a pledge and help support our campaign today! You can also help us spread the word about the Blingnet. Tell your friends and family and boast on Facebook & Twitter that you're a backer! #theblingnet
 After our campaign has been funded, we will see to it that production of the mold for the Blingnet begins right away. Once the mold has been produced, we'll get the first batch of Blingnets produced and begin mailing them out to everyone. 
If you would like additional Blingnets, just add the following contribution to your base Reward price:
                     Black/White: add $12 per Blingnet
                     Silver/Gold/Pink: add $15 per Blingnet
Pink Blingnets for Breast Cancer Awareness!
“There has to be a better way to safely & conveniently store my engagement ring! There has’ta be!” -Lizzie Severson
Any engaged or married woman cherishes her engagement and wedding ring and wants to ensure it stays safe and clean at all times. When Lizzie and Brad got engaged in 2011, Lizzie learned that to accomplish this, she had to either use inadequate ring holders or keep the ring on her finger. These options did not satisfy or comfort Lizzie's worries of losing or damaging her ring while cooking in the kitchen and working and cleaning around the house. She needed something better and we knew there were many others like her who needed something better too.
And so we created The Blingnet, a patent pending piece of awesomeness! When we began creating the Blingnet, we set out to make a jewelry holder that was convenient, easy to use, and capable of protecting precious bling in high risk areas like kitchens, bathrooms, and anywhere else.
Click to learn more about the creators!
Alright so it's a no brainer, a ring holder must provide safety for a ring. For us, convenience was equally as important. We didn't want to use an old jewelry box or dainty figurine stand or ring dish; those options cause clutter and, to us, are largely inconvenient and unsafe when used. 
We wanted something different. We wanted a magnet! Something that could magnetize to the fridge, to the stove, to the washer and dryer, and anywhere else we desired!
It had to be mobile. It needed to be readily available and quickly accessible before we got our hands dirty prepping some raw chicken for dinner, began a load of laundry, or simply washed our hands or face at the sink.
Our first drawings and discussions of the Blingnet ring holder started in January of 2012. We built a complicated first prototype in Brad's parents' garage and quickly learned what worked and what didn't. We doodled and daddled a lot, we researched, we googled, we prototyped and then we did that process over again some umpteen times. 
In 2013, we filed for a Trademark and a Patent with the USPTO and worked to get the Blingnet prepared for the masses. In 2014, our goal is to share our idea and our passion with everyone and start getting the Blingnet into homes all over the world.
We want your input!
You want more color options right? Let us know what other colors the Blingnet should come in! Go to theblingnet.com or click the link below and vote now!
Keep in touch, as we hope to offer some of the most requested colors as rewards after we hit our initial goal!

We've spent the past two years working on developing the Blingnet, improving its design, and protecting its intellectual property. It's been no easy task for us but we are proud of the work we've accomplished so far and the barriers we've overcome to get to where we are at. We are confident that, as we get ready to begin manufacturing the Blingnet, we are prepared to over come any new challenges.

Preparations are in place to use a local manufacturer in Arizona, Icon Injection Molding, who will provide the mold for the Blingnet and produce the Blingnet for the masses. They have been great to work with and we know working with them will allow us to bring the Blingnet to life. Once our campaign has been funded we will have the funds to issue the go ahead to get our mold produced and our first batch of Blingnets. We've been told and expect the turnaround time to be 2-3 months.

We've already received our first order of magnets which will take care of our first batch of Blingnets in order to fulfill our KickStarter rewards.

As far as shipping goes, Brad worked for four years at a UPS Store while he went through college and is quite the shipping and packaging expert. Rest assured, he'll make sure that that aspect of the campaign goes smoothly.

campaign.story:
Hey Kickstarter,
We are thrilled to present our debut Bamboo Collection: tees for men and women, polos for men and polo dresses for women sewn here in the U.S.A. 
WHY YOU SHOULD SUPPORT US:
Premium product – our t-shirts, polos and polo dresses are made to the highest standards possible
400 gallons – each garment we make saves at least 400 gallons of water as compared to traditionally manufactured cotton 
Environmentally friendly – our fabric and process reduces pollutants and toxins by up to 40%.
Health benefits – Our collection minimizes harm to the people who produce our textiles and garments and to the communities they live in.
Transparency – unlike other brands we have full traceability of our supply chain and we share this information with you.
Sewn in the U.S.A – unlike 97% of garments in stores we support local production.
Soft and comfortable – our fabric is extremely soft and 3.5 times more breathable than cotton.
 OUR STORY   
I was born in Paris, grew up in Israel and took my first steps in fashion in Amsterdam. After building a career in fashion as a merchandiser in London and Milan I moved to China as part of my quest to get closer to the product. While managing factories and later launching and growing my own e-commerce business in China, I was vividly confronted with fashion’s impact on people and planet and I didn’t like what I saw.
When my wife, had the opportunity to fulfill her dream to go to graduate school in the US, I came along for the ride. I found myself in Durham, North Carolina as she’s studying environmental management at Duke.
While immersing myself in reading and conversations on the environmental impact of fashion, I realized its approach to sustainability is simply not scientific enough. I founded Constant Simplicity with the goal of changing that.
SCIENTIFIC APPROACH
We teamed up with researches from Duke University to take decision-making in fashion to the next level. We design, source and produce to the highest possible quality and base all of our decisions on an analysis of the environmental impact of each fabric, component and stitch. We use a tool called Life Cycle Assessment to help us make the best decisions in terms of sourcing and manufacturing, and make it a point to know everything we can about the people involved in making our clothes. This way we can offer our customers complete transparency in our supply chain and ensure the minimum possible impact in terms of resources and people.  
OUR REWARDS:
THE T-SHIRT IN DETAILS:
We wanted a t-shirt that can be basic and casual but go well with a jacket and help you stay comfortable and smart altogether. Double needle stitch across the shoulders helps reinforce the area with the greatest friction on a t-shirt.
The bamboo rayon fabric has very soft properties and drapes very easily on the body.
THE POLO & POLO DRESS IN DETAILS
COLLAR
Our collar is a modern cut collar. 2 inch cut at the perfect angle. It is a Banded collar - a standing band-shaped collar that encircles the neck. This is a true sign of premium polo shirts. Most brands try to reduce their costs and avoid the more complex construction required for a banded collar on a polo shirt. It reinforces the collar, makes it last longer, helps it “sit” better and just looks so much better.
PLACKET
We feel that a 3 buttons polo shirt is the best choice for comfort and style for men. For the ladies we designed a 5 buttons placket, the long placket is a great visual bonus for a basic item but it also helps increase comfort and increased styling options for ladies of all shapes and sizes.
SEAT
Polos are meant for active men. We added what is known as a “tennis tail” – meaning there is a small oppening at the bottom of the shirt with the back being ½ an inch longer. This is a wonderful feature that allows you to have more freedom in movement.
SLIT
The polo dress has a 3.5 inch long slit. A small detail but it gives you great freedom in movement, no matter you shape and size.
POCKET
We love the pocket on the polo shirt for men. It is small but not too small. At 3 ½ inch in its widest point (horizontally) and 4 ½ inch at its longest point (vertically) it is modern and functional.
BUTTONS
Our buttons are 100% natural made from coconuts. They are of a natural tan color and we especially chose them to be 0.6 inch in diameter. This is only slightly larger than average but helps compliment the colors of the collection. The buttons are made in Panama, the coconut is from Ecuador. Dyeing is done with all natural, non-toxic, biodegradable dyes. Our supplier takes pride in producing a sustainable safe and beautiful product.
SLEEVES
The sleeves are reinforced at the armband with a turned over finish. This reinforces the sleeve at the point where it bears most of the friction and helps accentuate a more pronounced style.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We spent most of the past year working with our team and partners to develop the first samples of the bamboo collection. We spent countless hours researching and designing the best supply chain and working hard on reducing the environmental impact and finding the best partners to work with.

SCALE
To be able to offer our premium collection at affordable prices we have to reach high production minimums. Often with kickstarter projects scaling up due to high demand can be a problem. We worked hard to ensure that we are able handle small and very high demand alike. 

PARTNERS
We hand picked each partner across the chain of supply to try and reduce potential problems. They all share our vision and are working hard with us to deliver the best product possible.

SHIPPING AND CUSTOMS
This is normally the dread of new fashion brands. Luckily we have a rich experience and have chosen our logistics partners in advance to minimize any potential problems and try to deliver the goods in the fastest manner possible.

TRACEABILITY AND QUALITY
We promise to inspect and follow each step of the production to ensure the best product possible is delivered.

A PROMISE
We are not here just to make a great product. How it is made, who makes it, under which conditions and a scientific measure of each step is what we are about. This is what we promise and what we will deliver. This campaign is just the starting point in our adventure.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
You know the frustration. Tangled %#^###! earbuds. Every time you pull your earbuds out of your pocket, purse, or backpack, you waste time untangling. Thirty seconds of frustration each time, totaling 5 hours per year solving a Rubik's cube like puzzle (Your mileage may vary). Yes, not one of life's bigger problems - just an annoying, everyday problem faced by most earbuds users. And it has not been solved well - until now.
We tried the other cord organizers, but we wanted a widget that was:
1. Small. Small enough to stay unobtrusively attached on the cord so it's always available and you can't misplace.
2. Simple. Minimal design with no fasteners, like Velcro or magnets, that might fasten to stuff in your pocket. 
3. Fast. Quick release of your stored earbuds. No missed calls due to time consuming unwinding.
In short, Budsband is the smallest, simplest, fastest way to store your earbuds tangle-free, and more. Budsband is a simple, silicone band organizer that enables you to neatly wrap and compactly band the cord so it will stay tangle-free.
It is designed to stay attached to your cord so it's always there when you need it. The unique Budsband fastener-free design uses the earbuds' plug to secure the cord tangle-free. To store your earbuds, simply wrap them into a bundle, stretch the band around the bundle and secure the end with the earbuds’ plug (see picture "worth lots of words" below). To use your stored earbuds, simply unband for quick access.
Also, Budsband can shorten your cords to a desired length and it is so light it will not interfere with your listening. And it can tether your earbuds to zippers or buttons to keep the cord retained. Retention of cords is important to prevent the weight of the cords from pulling the earbuds out of your ears while exercising. Plus, it is a convenient way to hold your earbuds hands-free when you take a break from listening.
It is the first organizer that does not use a plastic spool or fasteners, thereby making it smaller, simpler and faster.
1. Attaches to the cord unobtrusively. Always available when needed. Budsband is designed to stay on the cord, unlike other organizers, which are easily misplaced. It's so small and light you won't know it is there. It's the smallest and lightest organizer available.
2. Simple, compact, tangle-free organization. Budsband stores your earbuds in a compact bundle that makes it easy to slip in your pocket, purse or gym bag. It is 2-10 times smaller than the others. The compact and simple, fastener-free design lessens the likelihood of your earbuds getting entangled with other stuff, like keys.
3. Fast access to your earbuds  - unband, no unwinding. When you get an incoming phone call, you don’t have time to unwind. Unlike other organizers, Budsband makes accessing your stored earbuds super fast. 
Wait, there’s more it can do…..
Shortens cords. Sometimes you want the cord shortened. Simply bundle the portion to shorten and wrap it with Budsband. Since the band is elastic, it keeps the smaller bundle secure.
Tethers to retain cord. The dangling cord can be get in the way of your listening. It can snag on other objects or the weight of the cord can pull the earbuds out of your ears, especially while jogging. By tethering the hole on Budsband to a suitable object on your clothing – such as a zipper or button –Budsband solves this problem. Plus, it is a convenient way to hold your earbuds hands-free when you take a break from listening. Obviously, this feature has a drawback; you need an object to tether to - a t-shirt won't work. 
Works on Apple’s iPhone 5 and 6 Lightning charging cables. It keeps your charging cord neat, compact and organized. It is a bit harder to slide over the plug the first time, but doable. And you only need to attach it once. Worth the attachment pain. (NOTE: Works on Apple; off-brands may have bigger plug housing and it may not fit)
Works on standard 3.5mm earbuds. Whatever style or brand of earbuds, Budsband should fit. While we have not tested every single brand, as long as it can fit over the plug to attach to the cord, it will work.
After the close of the Kickstarter campaign, we will send a survey to you to select your colors. We ship in two packs so you need to pick colors in sets of two of the same color.
Budsband is designed to stay on the cord so it is always there when you need it. So you need to attach it only once. To attach, thread the plug through the two adjacent holes in the enlarged end starting with the hole adjacent the band portion. Position Budsband on the cord right next to the plug's plastic housing. 
PLAY

After the one-time attaching Budsband to the cord, it is 3 fast steps:
If you watched the above video, you saw just how fast and easy it is. Trust us, we're lying. The first time, it is not that smooth, like tying your shoes the first time wasn't. But after a couple times, you will get it down. And there is no right way to do it. Just bundle, wrap, secure and Budsband will do the job.
 Sometimes, the simplest solution is the best.
Here's one of our concepts for packaging. Each package contains 2 Budsbands in the same color. Expect changes as we fine tune.
Note that Budsbands will ship in a great looking retail package of 2 Budsbands. Use one for your earbuds and the other for your charging cable (iPhone 5, Lightning), or give it to a family member. Budsband makes the perfect gift for anyone with earbuds, so stock up and save even more.
 As you can see, we have done everything we can on our own to get the product refined, tested and ready for production. Now, we just need you.
The above photo shows a few of our hand-made prototypes. All produced without slicing a finger, despite the combination of beer and sharp blades.
Ready for Production. Manufacturer selected, production mold built, sample parts made. Finding the right supplier has taken months. We are working with an experienced, high quality manufacturer that works with many brand name companies. They are U.S. based (fewer communication issues) and own overseas manufacturing facilities. We have met personally with the owner. The company can produce everything we need: the tooling, the parts, the packaging and assemble the parts into the package. Plus, they ship the finished products via air freight to our door.
To test their quality and responsiveness, we already had them make a mold and run sample parts for our functional testing. We are confident that they can produce the quantity and high quality of parts we require. 
Producing actual molded parts has been invaluable to test the design since there is not a way to 3D print with silicone. We intended to make a prototype mold and make the production mold after the Kickstarter project finished, but the production mold was the same price as a prototype one. We have refined the design twice for the production tool to make it even easier to use and this means you will get your rewards even sooner since we spared you 2 design iterations.
We have conducted testing on the molded samples with many users (no LD50 tests were needed). Budsband works well on the variety of earbuds we tested. Plus, it is very strong and stretchable with a finish that feels even better than it looks.
Good Widget Company makes innovative products so simple that you will smile.
Good Widget Company is an Ann Arbor, Michigan based company started by an experienced entrepreneur, Ed Farrell, and a professional graphic designer, Kevin Ryan. We have extensive background in bringing new products to market as an entrepreneur and as a graphic designer bringing other entrepreneurs' dreams to reality. Ed is the founder of CrowdJuice, a mobile event guide and networking app for professional conferences. Previously, he co-founded CareerSite Corporation, a pioneering Internet company, that combined software and business model innovation to change the way recruiting was done. Kevin’s day job is for Alfajango.com where he helps entrepreneurs build their startups.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
RISKS:

While one of the project creators is an experienced entrepreneurs with a successful track record of complex new product development, there are always risks, identified below. For this project we have significant "skin in the game" in both dollars and time. We have worked really hard to minimize product and manufacturing risks so that we can deliver a great product according to the timeline. We have an aggressive timeline and it is possible for it to slip if we encounter significant, unforeseen problems in manufacturing. If we encounter any issues that will impact our timeline, we will communicate with you in a timely fashion. If any of the risks will cause you to lose sleep at night, you should not back this or any other Kickstarter project. We want you to smile and not sleeping may adversely affect your ability to smile. Here are the risks we see:

MANUFACTURING
The biggest risk in product design projects is making and delivering the product according to the timeline, so we wanted to lessen that risk. We have selected and met with a quality supplier with brand name customers that can make the mold, run parts in high quantities, print the packaging and assembly and ship the parts to us. They are U.S. based with overseas manufacturing facilities. We have already made the mold to run sample parts. The photos of the white Budsband are actual production mold versions. Since they have already made our parts with the mold, we are confident they can make quality parts. We have not made the product in colors yet, but we are fairly confident our supplier can deliver these without significant issues. We plan to begin begin testing colors once we hit the goal so we are ready once the campaign ends. Delays due to unforeseen problems are still possible though; we will let you know if they occur. Order fulfillment and shipping to you will begin as soon as we receive the product by air from the manufacturer.

APOCALYPSE
Granted, this one is not likely, but we are thorough. Unfortunately, we fear we will be among those left behind; however, this is good for you if you are still around, since we will make a "good faith" effort to get your Budsband delivered. And we're guessing you will need to use your earbuds more than ever in such a situation. If you are among the lucky ones, you won't need your earthly stuff anyway so we hope you won't have a way to contact a lawyer - on the remote chance there are any left behind with us. And I know I will be without my counsel.

campaign.story:
UPDATE: After being fully funded in just 5 days, we have a new stretch goal of $95,000. 
And a generous donor has said every dollar we raise over $45,000 will be MATCHED to double the impact!
This will allow us to expand the scope and quality of the investigation. 
We will be able to purchase a second drone, improve the photography equipment, and expand the number of states and farms investigated! 
Hi, my name is Will Potter. I'm an independent journalist based in Washington, D.C., and the author of Green Is The New Red: An Insider’s Account of a Social Movement Under Siege. I am also a 2014 TED Fellow. 
My work focuses on animal rights and environmental issues, and civil liberties post 9/11. It has been featured in the world’s top media outlets, including the Washington Post, NPR, Rolling Stone, Foreign Policy, and El Pais. I've testified before the U.S. Congress about my reporting, and I've lectured at nearly 200 universities and public forums about my work, including Harvard Law School, Georgetown University, and the House of Democracy and Human Rights in Berlin. 
I have extensively documented how protest and whistleblowing is being criminalized. Now, in my new project, I am going to use new investigative journalism tools to help expose what some corporations want to keep hidden.
Photographer Mishka Henner documented factory farm pollution—like this waste lagoon at a Texas feedlot—by satellite. What else could drone photography uncover?
Factory Farms Want to Keep You in the Dark
A wave of undercover investigations by groups like the Humane Society have exposed shocking cruelty on factory farms: cows being kicked in the face, turkeys beaten with pipes, and chickens packed in filthy cages so small they cannot even flap a wing. This whistleblowing has prompted the largest meat recall in U.S. history and multiple criminal prosecutions. Rather than address these abuses, though, the agriculture industry is trying to hide them from consumers. 
New "ag-gag" laws make it illegal to photograph animal cruelty on factory farms; in some cases, exposing cruelty can lead to more jail time than committing it. These bills have already become law in Utah, Iowa, Missouri, and Idaho. Right now, more states are considering them, and they are spreading globally. The agriculture industry in Australia is modeling its "ag-gag" laws after those in the states. 
The latest trend is that the agriculture industry is even trying to ban photographs of farms taken from the air. It is unlikely that aerial photography can document animal abuse, but these industries are clearly concerned. So what are factory farms trying to hide? Will a drone allow us to see the scope of pollution caused by these industrial operations? I'm going to find out... 
Let's Shine a Light
As a journalist, I think the best way to confront these attempts at secrecy is to shine a light on the abuses.
With your support, I will:
Lawfully document factory farms in multiple states using aerial drone photography.
Create a short documentary about factory farms and the "ag-gag" controversy using aerial drone footage, and interviews with whistleblowers.
Publish an e-book that combines these photographs with in-depth investigative reporting on factory farms and "ag-gag" legislation.  
Use the investigation to contribute to public debate about "ag-gag" laws internationally.
Brief media and policymakers about the findings of my investigation 
Share what I have learned about using drones for reporting with other journalists and professional journalism associations.
Plus offer some fun, unique perks to say THANK YOU for supporting investigative journalism!
"Ag-gag" laws are an attempt to silence whistleblowers who have exposed cruelty, like this injured and neglected piglet on a farm in Iowa.
Why Me? 
I've reported extensively on these attempts to silence investigators and whistleblowers, both in my award-winning book and news articles. My work on "ag-gag" has been featured by Salon, MSN, Democracy Now, VICE, Al Jazeera, and many other outlets.
My reporting overturned the first "ag-gag" prosecution.
I have lectured internationally about these laws, including Spain and Australia. And I spoke about my reporting as a TED Fellow. 
I am a plaintiff in the first lawsuits challenging an "ag-gag" law as unconstitutional. My position is supported by the Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press and 16 other professional journalism organizations.
I'm independent. My background is reporting for major newspapers, but by working independently I can report critically without having to answer to advertisers.
How Will Your Kickstarter Contribution Be Used?
Major costs associated with this investigation include:
Aerial photography equipment. (Please note that while there are some new consumer drones available for a few hundred dollars, they will not meet the technical demands of this project, including range of travel.)
Travel expenses (for Will Potter, videographer, and assistant) to multiple states and rural locations. This includes airfare, car rental, gas, food, and research expenses.
Legal counsel. In order to ensure the investigation is lawful and protected, we will need to consult with attorneys in multiple states. 
Video production and equipment.
Website development.
E-book production and publication.
Fees (Kickstarter has a 5% fee, plus Amazon has a 5% credit card fee).
Other Ways You Can Help
I hope you will support this critical project, in whatever way you can! If you cannot make a financial contribution, please consider:
Signing my Change.org petition against "ag-gag" laws. 
Subscribing to my email action list for the latest news on this issue.
Sharing this Kickstarter with your friends on Facebook, and starting a discussion about what factory farms are trying to hide.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Because an investigation like this hasn't been attempted before, I cannot make any guarantee of what I will be able to document. However, that's really the case with every investigative journalism project. I am accustomed to pushing through setbacks and detours in the course of my reporting, and I am confident that I will be able to do the same with this project. An additional risk/challenge is that, even though this photography is lawful, I will undoubtedly face harassment by factory farm owners or workers on site. I am committed to pursuing this lawful investigation and these are risks I am willing to face.
